loans.name: 08-Ts3-05-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits to resell.

Nga is 44 years old, and she is married with two children.

Nga is the group leader of her solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Gladis Consuelo

texts.es: Gladis de 29 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, ella es una madre muy responsable quien se entrega de lleno a su negocio junto a su suegra para contar con todo lo necesario en el hogar. Ella posee una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación en donde comercializa: pan, aceite para cocina y algunos cosméticos entre otros productos, cuenta con clientes fijo, razón principal por la que desea contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de huevos, productos para el hogar como jabones y desinfectantes, bebidas y otros más. Gladis solicita el préstamo  a INTEGRAL con lo que espera alcanzar lo anterior y de esta forma contar con una estabilidad económica para sus hijos y su suegra quien es un gran apoyo para Gladis.
texts.en: Gladis, 29, lives with her two young children, ages 8 and 5. She is a responsible mother who tends to her business along with her mother-in-law so that their home has everything it needs. She has a small store in her house where she sells bread, cooking oil and some cosmetics, among other things. She has established customers and she wants to have enough capital to buy eggs, household products like soaps and disinfectants, drinks and other things. Gladis asks for a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy those things and create economic stability for her children and her mother-in-law, who is a big support to Gladis.

loans.use: to buy detergent and drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines.
She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.
Elizabeth has been in this business for 6 years. She earns other income from raising pigs.
Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is married, 52 years of age and lives in Gabunon, Tambulig with her two kids. Leonora is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than five years and she earns 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) every month. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC this year. Leonora wishes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah works hard to support her family. Hannah is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.
Hannah requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
Hannah has been in this business for 30 years now.
In the future, Hannah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines.
She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.
Luz has been in this business for 12 years. Luz earns other income from raising pigs.
Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose;el socio continua con su negocio de fabricacion de velas,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio elabora diferentes tipos de tamaño y modelos para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como fiestas patronales , misas entre otros,el socio es una persona responsable y emprendedor siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como parafina.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jose belongs to the “Unidos para el Triunfo" communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower continues with his business of making candles. He has been in this business for years, which is going well, thanks to the effort he devotes to it each day. 

José makes various sizes and styles for the various engagements where they are requested, such as patron saint's fiestas, masses and other occasions. 

The borrower is a responsible and enterprising person, and this is how he gets ahead in life. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy materials for his business, such as paraffin.

José is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way, and promises to make his installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business such as paraffin.

loans.name: 08- Ts3 -06- Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase beverages, candy, biscuits, yogurt and ice cream to resell.

Bình is 56 years old, and she is married with one child. Bình is the group leader of the 08-TS3-06-Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, candy, biscuits, yogurt and ice cream to resell.

loans.name: 08-Pt2-09-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a service business, providing makeup sessions. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to make performance clothes for hiring.

Lan is 32 years old, and she is married with 2 children.
Lan is the group leader of the 08-PT2-09 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She works and lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Lan has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make performance clothes for hiring.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena, tiene 54 años de edad, casada, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a sus dos nietos.
Doña María Elena, hace 12 años que  decidió tener su propio negocio y estableció el servicio de transporte de taxi, inicio con uno, actualmente ya tiene dos taxis y paga dos empleados quienes trabajan con ellos. Este negocio es rentable para ella pues se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos. Los ha mantenido en buen estado mediante la inversión de varios préstamos que ODEF le ha otorgado. Actualmente solicita 21,000 Lempiras, siendo su quinto préstamo ya,  con el cual va a reparar un taxi para brindar un buen servicio. Espera arreglarlo bien y obtener sus ingresos. Su meta es seguir trabajando con el negocio para ayudar a sus nietos con la educación.
texts.en:
María Elena is 54 years old. She is married, and lives with her two grandchildren in the municipality of Tela, in Atlántida department.

María Elena decided 12 years ago to have her own business, and set up a taxi transportation service. She started with one, and currently has two taxis. She pays two employees who work with them. 

This business is profitable for her, and has become her source of income. She has kept the taxis in good condition through the investment of several loans that ODEF has granted her. 

Currently she is requesting 21,000 lempiras, this being her fifth loan already.  With it, she is going to repair a taxi, in order to offer good service. She hopes to fix it properly and earn her income. 

Her goal is to continue working with the business, so that she can help her grandchildren with their education.

loans.use: For maintenance and repair of her taxi.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 66 years old. She is a widow with 11 children.
Hope works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries in her general store.
Hope has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she also earns income from electronic reloading.
Hope aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 42 years old, and she has two children who are in school.
Josephine has a welding shop in the Philippines. Josephine requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her welding shop business.
Josephine has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her welding shop business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is from the village of Gabunon in the municipality of Tambulig. She is 42 years old. Cecelia is married and has six children. To make a living, Cecelia runs a general store, selling a variety of foods and home-use products in the local community. Cecelia has been in her business for 5 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Cecelia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps. In 2010, Cecelia joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from photocopy and computer rental services.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Merlita has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of frozen products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her buying and selling of frozen products business.

Thelma has been in this business for 15 years. Thelma earns more income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru:
Дамире 45 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Дамира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, в течении 3 лет занимается изготовлением и реализацией хлеба – лепешек, выпекаемых в тандыре – глиняной печи, отапливаемой при помощи дров и угля. Благодаря доходам от бизнеса, Дамира смогла построить дом для своей семьи и подготовить приданое для двух дочерей. 
На данный момент готовую продукцию Дамира отправляет на старой машине, требующей каждодневного ремонта и починки частей. В целях дальнейшего успешного развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на вложение в покупку погрузочного авто для транспортировки лепешек на базар и магазины.  На часть доходов от кредита Дамире хотела бы вложить в обучение двух младших сыновей, а в дальнейшем - планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Damira is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. For the past 3 years, as the main source of income for her family, Damira has been baking and selling bread - flatbreads made in a tandoor, a clay oven heated with wood and coal. Thanks to her business' profits, Damira has been able to build a home for her family and to prepare dowry for her two daughters. Presently, she delivers prepared breads in an old car, which requires daily repairs and many spare parts.

In order to continue successfully developing her business, Damira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a new cargo vehicle for transporting her flatbreads to shops and markets. Damira would like to use a portion of her profits from this loan for her two youngest sons' education, and also to continue investing into expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy a car for transporting her flatbreads

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 57 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Aurora has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Aurora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica  de 33 años de edad vive en en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, lugar que ha desarrollado su zona urbana, conservando el centro histórico y convirtiéndose en uno de los puertos de mayor importancia en Colombia, el Caribe y el mundo, así como un célebre destino turístico. Allí en un ambiente soleado, de playa, brisa y mar habita con sus 5 hijos en las edades de 3 a 16 años, quienes son el motor de su desempeño en su trabajo diario, el cual realiza en su propia casa, vendiendo refrescos y mercancía variada, a solicitud de su clientela;  actividad que inició una vez ocurrió la separación, de su esposo hace 2 años y decidió  con sus ingresos se hacerse cargo de su familia,  trabajando esforzadamente para lograr algún día salir adelante y aumentar cada vez mas su bienestar. . Con su negocio le ha ido muy bien y da gracias a Dios, porque ha logrado ahorrar la cuota inicial con la que compró su vivienda.  Su meta es lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo para explorar mercados en los cuales no ha logrado llegar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprara en mayor volumen refrescos y bebidas por cajas, para tener un stock disponible, que le permita responder con productos bien refrigerados a su clientela y lograr con ello aumentar el número de estos. Mónica está muy agradecida con el crédito anterior otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues con el logró tener su casa propia en el macroproyecto de vivienda de interés social Ciudad Bicentenario, donde ella y su familia se sienten mas cómodas; ahora su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograr muchos de sus sueños empresariales y esto es lo que poco a poco logrará con sus credikivas consecutivos a los que aspira.
texts.en:
Monica, 33, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias, which has developed its urban area, preserved its history and is becoming one of the most important ports in Colombia, the Caribbean and the world, as well as a popular tourist destination. Monica lives in this sunny environment with a beach and sea breeze, with her ​​5 children aged 3 to 16 years who are her motivation in her daily work. 

Monica works from home selling soft drinks and varied merchandise in accordance with customer requirements. She started her business after separating from her husband 2 years ago, and decided to take care of her family with her income. She works hard to succeed and increase their wellbeing each day. Monica's business has done very well and she is thankful to God because she managed to save up for the down payment to purchase her home. 

Her goal is to increase her working capital so that she can explore markets that she has not yet managed to. Monica has applied for her second credikiva with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy cases of soft drinks and refreshments in greater volumes. This will enable her to maintain an inventory in order to respond to her clients with well-chilled products, and increase her client base. 

Monica is very grateful for the previous loan granted by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she managed to purchase her own home in the social housing macroproject Ciudad Bicentenario (Bicentennial City), where she and her family feel more comfortable. Her main challenge now is to earn sufficient working capital to achieve many of her entrepreneurial dreams, which is what she hopes to gradually achieve through consecutive credikivas.

loans.use: to purchase cases of refreshments and soft drinks in greater volumes

loans.name: Arnida

texts.en:
Arnida is 33 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arnida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Arnida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, and canned goods. 

In the future, Arnida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Maricel has been in this business for two years. Maricel earns more income from farming vegetables.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she coan afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Deoncita

texts.en:
Deoncita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now, and works hard to support her family.

Deoncita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her business. 

In the future, Deoncita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Lilia has been in this business for six years, and earns more income from selling gasoline.

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
A 56-year-old mother from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Ath overcomes her family's hardships and supports her children through rice farming. She has six children, two of whom are living with her and still need her support, as they do not earn much income from their current jobs as garment factory workers. 

She has been in the business of rice farming for 22 years. This is her sixth loan cycle with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used her past loans, which she has completely paid back, in an effective way to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes to own a motorbike which will help her to travel to the marketplace to sell her cash-crop, saving her time which she can use to better care for her children and her business.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to support her business.

loans.name: Damaris Leonor

texts.es: Damaris de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Damaris posee una tortillería, en la cual trabaja desde hace más de 2 años, la cual ha sido un negocio bastante rentable, debido a que la tortilla por ser parte de la dieta básica de los salvadoreños, posee mucha demanda. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual a pesar que posee ayuda de su esposo, desea salir adelante y contar con una mejor estabilidad económica en la cual no le haga falta nada a su familia. Damaris solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la venta de tortillas comprando maíz por mayor para obtenerlo a menor precio, de esta manera ella podrá elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas lo que será muy lucrativo para ella.
texts.en:
Damaris, 31, lives with her husband and two underage children who are in school. Damaris has a tortilla shop where she has worked for more than two years. It has been a very profitable business because tortillas are a staple in the Salvadorian diet and thus, are in high demand. She is a hardworking and visionary woman.  Despite having help from her husband, she wants to get ahead and have greater financial stability so that her family is not in need of anything. 

Damaris is asking for a loan so she can have the  money she needs to invest in her business of selling tortillas. She will use the money to buy corn wholesale so that the cost will be cheaper.  In this way, she will be able to produce a greater number of tortillas which will be very profitable for her.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: 02.01.06 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Huệ is the group leader of the 02.01.06 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

She lives in Thanh Hoa City, is 44 years old and is married with two children. Her children are grown up, and she has no dependents to support. 

Huệ is applying for a loan to purchase fruit to resell. She operates a business selling fruit, and has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2004, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old and is married with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. Julieta has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Julieta has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Julieta aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: 02.01.05 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Tự is the group leader of the 02.01.05 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

Tự is 50 years old and is married with four children. She lives with two of her dependent children in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her other two children are grown up.

She works in agriculture, growing rice, and has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Tự is applying for a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale. 

In 2004, Tự joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tự has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tự hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es un señor de 65 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en el cantón de Turrialba ubicado en la  provincia de Cartago. La ciudad de Cartago fue capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823, se caracteriza por tener un  relieve montañoso formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca, su clima es frío la mayoría del año consecuencia de los dos volcanes que posee llamados  Irazú y Turrialba.
Desde hace muchos años Ismael se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la producción de café, ha logrado formar su propio cafetal gracias a que ha recibido varios créditos con la empresa comunal local, ha crecido económicamente y mejorado su calidad de vida.  
Actualmente desea obtener un microcrédito por un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) para comprar almácigo de café y renovar las plantas viejas de su cafetal, de esta manera obtiene mejores cosechas, colabora con los gastos del hogar y vive mejor.
El  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Dice que con este crédito espera poder seguir creciendo como agricultor. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede sacar mayor  provecho a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Ismael, 65, lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita in the canton of Turrialba located in the province of Cartago. The city of Cartago was the capital of Costa Rica until 1823. It is known for having a mountainous relief formed by two mountain ranges: the Central and the mountain range of Talamanca.  The climate is cold most of the year due to the two volcanoes in the area called Irazu and Turrialba. 

Ismael has made his living in agriculture for many years, specifically in the production of coffee. He has succeeded in creating his own coffee plantation because of the various loans he has received with the local communal bank. He has grown financially and improved his quality of life. 

Currently, he would like a loan for one million forty thousand colones (CRC 1,040,000) to buy small coffee plants and  replace the old plants in his plantation.  In this way he will have a better harvest, be able to contribute to household expenses, and have a better life. 

He is part of the Empresa de Credito Communal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. He says that with this loan he expects to be able to continue to grow as a farmer. He points out that thanks to this type of organization and the loan facilitators, he is able to make the most of his trade.

loans.use: to buy small coffee plants

loans.name: Luljeta

texts.en:
Luljeta is a 49-year-old lady, who, until recently, lived in an abusive marriage in the most rural area in the north of the country. Divorce there is considered a societal taboo and it has a negative impact especially on women, who are viewed less favorably than men. However, in spite of all this, Luljeta divorced her husband and together with her own son, came to reside in another region, where divorced women are not viewed as badly as in her own region. 

The abuse, the divorce and the move have taken a toll on her. Upon arriving in the new location, she finally found a job of her own as a waitress and decided to make some basic renovations to her place. This is the reason why she has requested a loan from Kiva via the VisionFund Albania institution and is thanking both organizations in advance for the opportunity she has been granted. 
She is excited about the possibility of finally finding the peace she has dreamed of for so long.

loans.use: To make basic home renovations

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is married with 3 kids. Noralyn is 41 years old and is residing at Gabunon, Tambulig. Noralyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2010, Noralyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Noralyn wants a business expansion someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy raw materials to make handcrafted baskets.

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
Cheril is 37 years old and married with 4 children. With 1 child in school, Cheril works very hard to provide for them.

Cheril runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. Cheril has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Cheril would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 40 years old and married with three children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. Imelda aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a soft drinks retail business in the Philippines.

Ma. Theresa requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth,  tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella nació  en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació,  ella se dedica a la venta de plásticos y productos desechables, ella tiene una pequeña tienda y implementada con las necesidad básicas pero el local es alquilado. Ya son cuatro meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  La socia Yaneth solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería como por ejemplo platos de tecknopor, bolsa de plástico, tenedores y cucharas desechables. La socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia Yaneth pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III” y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower Yaneth is 30 years old, married and has two children. She was born in the beautiful city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. 

She works selling plastic items and disposable products. She has a small store that has the basic needs but the facility is rented. She has been in business for four months and already things are going well. 

Yaneth is asking for a loan in order to buy more merchandise, for example, styrofoam plates, plastic bags, and disposable forks and spoons. The borrower is a happy person eager to get ahead.

Yaneth belongs to the communal bank Comuzone III and is happy about this loan and she agrees to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as styrofoam dishes, plastic bags, disposable forks and spoons

loans.name: 01.05.04 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thắm operates a food stall/restaurant selling rolls. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

Thắm is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children. Thắm is the group leader of the 01.05.04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has no dependents as her children are grown up.

In 2004, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thắm has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thắm has been involved in this business for 5 years.The main hardship that Thắm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio FERNANDO pertenece al banco comuna “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”,el socio continua dedicandose al negocio de elaboracion de velas ,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio cuenta con un taller donde realiza la elaboracion de las velas , el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa,el socio elabora diferetes tipos y tamaños de velas para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan,el socio es una personsa responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para su negocio como parafina. 
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The borrower, Fernando, belongs to the communal bank Unidos Para el Triunfo (United for Success). 

He continues working in his business making candles. He has spent years in this business which is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into the business every day. He has a workshop where he makes the candles which is located in his home. He makes various types and sizes of candles for the requested orders. He is a responsible and enterprising person and because of this he is able to support his family.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for his business such as paraffin.

He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and he promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his candle making business such as paraffin

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
EL SR. JESUS VIVE CON SU ESPOSA, TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO DESDE HACE YA MAS DE 12 AÑOS, EL ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y MUY TRABAJADORA, HA DEDICADO SU VIDA EN EJERCER SU PROFESION DE LICENCIADO, POR LO CUAL SE HA ESFORZADO EN MANTENER SU DESPACHO PRESENTABLE PARA EL USO DE SU LABOR. SU OFICINA LA TIENE UBICADA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, Y HA BUSCADO SIEMPRE LA MANERA DE DARLE LA PRESENTACION ADECUADA PARA SUS CLIENTES.
POR TAL MOTIVO, EL SR. JESUS ACUDE ANTE ESTA INSTITUCION CON EL PROPOSITO DE OBTENER UN CREDITO QUE LE PERMITA REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE UN EQUIPO DE COMPUTO, CON EL CUAL VE EL BENEFICIO DE BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Jesus lives with his wife. He has had his own business for more than 12 years. He is a responsible and hardworking person. 

He has dedicated his life to working in his profession as a lawyer, and so he has put effort into keeping a presentable office to do his work. His office is located in his home and he has always wanted to give the appropriate appearance for his clients. This is why Jesus came to the institution to ask for a loan that will allow him to buy computer equipment which he sees as a way to give better service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment to use in his work as a lawyer so he can give better service to his clients

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 40 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. 

Elvie has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. This time she has requested a 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items for her store, like snack foods, soap, and other miscellaneous items.

Elvie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods and soap for her general store.

loans.name: 01.05.06 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mùi is 33 years old, married and has two children. Mùi lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mùi operates a food stall/restaurant, selling rolls. Mùi has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Mùi is the group leader of the 01.05.06 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2012, Mùi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mùi has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make food to sell.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make food to sell.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, sugar and other groceries.

NWTF is relisting Estrellita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Philbert

texts.en:
Philbert is 40 years old and single.

He earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Philbert has been buying and selling livestock for four years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Philbert is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

NWTF is listing Felixberta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en:
Florites is 32 years old and married. She has two children.

Florites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Florites has been in this business for two years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Florites aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar, 38, is a skillful driver and she runs a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has been operating her business for 12 years nonstop for her family. She is unmarried and lives with only her daughter in an apartment with two rooms.
 
Her daughter, Margad-Erdene, 18, has a chin failure and her mother has been trying to support her daughter to heal it for many years. Recently, she decided that her daughter will have surgery in the state medical center. It is a hard surgery and the medical expenses will be quite costly. The loan she is requesting will be used to cover the cost of her daughter’s surgery.

loans.use: To cover the cost of her daughter’s surgery.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is single and a mother of one child, age eleven years. She is age 24 and has been active in farming for five successive years in her rural home in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produce includes mainly maize, beans, milk and tea, with the latter being a specialty of the region. She runs a retail shop business as well.

Naomi has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to start poultry farming. She says the loan will help her diversify her farming business and generate income throughout the year, which will in turn improve her family's living standards.

She thanks Juhudi Kilimo for the farming support but points out that low prices for farming products and animal diseases are the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds to raise.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 41 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. Marina has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to be used for purchasing feeds. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Marina hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo, 34 years old and a married entrepreneur with 3 children in Poblacion, Bonifacio, is earning from his private transport service business. It was started almost 3 years ago and he earns about 10,000 PHP a month. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to buy accessories and tires. He just joined GDMPC in 2011. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long..

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj, 25, works as a manager in a state organization. He is unmarried and currently he lives with his parents, who are pensioners. However, his father has been working as a driver since he retired for extra earnings for supporting his son. They own a house that was built many years ago in the ger district of Mongolian nomadic yurts in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Recently, his father suffered a spinal cord injury when he fell while doing his job. He needs to have medical care and surgery as soon as possible. So his son, Purevdorj, wants to take a loan to cover the cost of his father’s medical expenses.

loans.use: To cover the cost of his father’s medical expenses.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 55 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. Candelaria has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She started this business just this year.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and other consumable products. She became a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Candelaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and other consumable products.

loans.name: 02.01.08 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Tú is 42 years old. She is married and has two grown children. Tú lives in Thanh Hoa City with no dependents. 

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 02.01.08 Đông Hải solidarity group. 

Tú operates a food stall, selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. This is Tú's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tú hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and a mother of four dependent children. She is 48 years old and lives in Lower Lodiong, Tambulig. 

Rufina makes and sells snack items to earn a living and has had this business for six years. She earns 3,500 PHP each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rufina joined GDMPC in 2009. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is married with 3 children. She is 49 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin. She is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional livestock. She has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Leonita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya, 47,  lives with her husband and her daughter, who is a student at medical college. Her husband, Tsolmonbaatar, runs a taxi around the city and customers pay him 700 MNT per kilometer.

Gantuya sells religious articles in the outdoor market in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been operating her business since 2010. 

She owns a stall in the bazaar and usually sells Buddhist religious articles to her customers. This summer she had a big sale and now she needs to increase her stocks. 

She has a plan to expand her business into a small religious shop within next few years. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying religious things from her supplier to increase her business stocks.

loans.use: To buy the religious articles from her supplier to increase her business stocks.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is single with 1 child. She is 36 years old and lives in Poblacion, Bonifacio. She owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns about 20,000 PHP each month. 

She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Titus's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married with 4 children. She is 62 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. Leonora is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years.

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers, both inorganic and commercial. She has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Leonora hopes to save money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, both inorganic and commercial.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 62-year-old from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She is engaged in buying and selling recycled items like empty bottles, plastic and scrap iron. She also own a sari-sari store business for an additional income. 

Antonia is asking for a loan to be used as additional capital to buy scrap items like empty bottles, plastic, and scrap iron that she can resell in bulk for a profit. She hopes that her hard work will eventually pay off and give her family a comfortable life. Her income will provide for a healthy diet and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy scrap items like empty bottles, plastic, and scrap iron

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is widowed with 6 children. She is 70 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Leonida sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to be used in purchasing raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Leonida hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 50 years old and lives in San Jose, Sinacaban. She is married with four children. 

Melissa has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Melissa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Melissa hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is married having three children and he is 46 years old, residing at D-Fernan, Bonifacio. Nestor is operating a crop venture, planting & harvesting corn for sale in the local community to earn a living and he has been 6 years in this business. Each month, he earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Nestor requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Nestor joined GDMPC. In the future, Nestor wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name of Zarrina lives in a flat which is in bad condition. Her husband’s salary is small and it is not enough for improving their living conditions. They have two clever children. 

Zarrina is a very good specialist. She works in a kindergarten. She must repair her flat. She must to change the doors and windows of her balcony and rooms.  She is asking for a loan of 1500 somoni  to buy doors and windows. 

In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please, help her and her family if it is possible.

loans.use: To buy new doors and windows for her flat

loans.name: Ilmira

texts.en:
Ilmira is married but has no children. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Ilmira decided to start a new business, working as a barber and a beautician. She has more than 5 years of experience in this work.

She has perfected her knowledge with the beauty salon, and now she wants to organize own business deal, renting wedding dresses and necklaces in order to generate an income that she can contribute to her home’s finances.  

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy wedding dresses and necklaces for organizing her new business. With the loan she will get through,  and her business will get to be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy wedding dresses and necklaces for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.en: Ajdar is a 46-year-old married man. He has 3 children ages 20 to 14. Ajdar operates a cook for 24 years. In the future he plans to purchase a new machine to prepare better food. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work and improve and increase his income. Today Ajdar has applied for the loan of 1,500 AZN to repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is 65 years old and lives in a small village in Kvareli district. He has a wife and a son. Valerian and his wife are provided with a retirement pension. The family runs their agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where maize is grown. He has a vineyard as well. Valerian picks grapes and produces wine, which is sold locally. Besides these activities, he is involved in the animal husbandry business. Valerian has 3 pigs and sells piglets in the nearby villages. Valerian is a very hardworking man with rich experience in his work, but he still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of his family.

Valerian requested a loan to roof the house. The other part of the loan will be used for renovation of the internal part of his home. He will be able to purchase building materials and repair the house, which is old and damaged. The living conditions of the family will improve and Valerian will realize his dream of giving his family a better life.

loans.use: to roof the house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 36 years old and married with four children who are in school. She operates a beauty salon to earn a living. Mary operates her business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. She has engaged in this business for 10 years and has employed one person. Mary's dream is to operate another outlet in a different location in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy braids and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy braids and hair oil

loans.name: Ifesowakpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFESOWAKPO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amis résidant dans un même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Justin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justin est âgé de 31 ans et est mariée à une marchande du nom de Baïra. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Justin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Justin exerce depuis une dizaine d’année, la couture dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Justin vend des cartes de recharges. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Justin s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Justin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFESOWAKPO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The IFESOWAKPO group is made up of three friends who live in the same neighborhood. Justin, the group's representative, is the man who is raising his hand in the photo. Justin is 31 years old and married to a merchant named Baïra. The couple has three children, all of whom live in their care. Some of their children have received schooling. Justin lives with his wife and children, and he and his wife both provide for the family's needs.

In order to provide for the family's various needs, Justin has been working as a couturier in his region for the past ten or so years. On the side, he sells phone cards. This business allows him to support his family without much difficulty. Justin stocks up in his region and in a town in Benin.

Striving to satisfy his customers and increase his sales and revenue, Justin, along with the other members of the IFESOWAKPO group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their business and increase their customer base and their revenue. Their previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and sewing supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella hace carteras de lana y sus productos lo exporta a Brasil,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio de artesania,la socia tambien vende artesania como chompas,pantalones y blusas,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lans e hilos para que haga las artesanias.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member has operated a crafts business for 8 years.  She makes wool purses, some of which she exports to Brazil.  She also makes sweaters and other clothing pieces.  She wants to expand the business so she's applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--wool, thread, etc.--to grow.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 54 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. She is married with 1 child. Merlyn has a store in the local community that sells chicken products. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional chicken products to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken products to sell.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 28-year-old married man and the father of two children aged two and four. He sells animals that he raises at the bazaar. Zaur has 20 years experience in this line of business. Also, he plans to increase the number of animals and so he wants to buy cattle. 

Zaur is requesting a loan from VisionFund for AZN 1,200. He is going to buy a car to start a taxi service. He believes that this loan will allow him to earn more money to have a better life for his family.

loans.use: To buy a car to start a taxi service.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Imelda is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 24 years old. He is married to Jackline and they are blessed with four children aged 12, 8, 6, and 2 years. Moses has been growing wheat in large scale. The business is doing well with good income.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after he successfully serviced his previous loans. He intends to use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs and seedlings and prepare the land.  

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his farm business. His dream is to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seedlings and prepare the land

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjobiyon Sabine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adjobiyon Sabine est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Honoré. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différentes charges, Adjobiyon Sabine vend des céréales (maïs, farine de manioc) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adjobiyon Sabine vend des fagots de bois. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Adjobiyon Sabine s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adjobiyon Sabine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
This group called MAHUTIN is made up of three persons who are friends and who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Adjobiyon Sabine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 42 and married to Honoré. The couple have three children, of whom some are enrolled in school. All are living under their parents' roof. The couple cooperate in supporting their family. 

To be able to contribute to various expenses, Adjobiyon Sabine sells cereals (maize and manioc flour) out of her house. At the same time, she also sells firewood. This activity allows her to take care of her needs without great difficulty. 

Adjobiyon Sabine buys her wares in her region and in a town in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her sales and thus her revenue, Adjobiyon Sabine is requesting, together with the other members of the group called MAHUTIN, a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will permit them to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their income. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy cereals (maize, manioc flour) and firewood

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a resident of Eldoret, in the North Rift area of Kenya. She is aged 36 and married with two children aged six and four years. She has been  dairy farming for over ten years in her rural home area, producing milk for the local Nangili Dairy. Besides farming, she also runs a tailoring business.

Carolyne is seeking a second loan with Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She also used her first loan to buy a cow and she believes the skills she has acquired in farming will help her to reap the best benefits from her farming investments. Her focus is to make farming her core business and give her children a better education.

Carolyne knows that she faces harsh challenges from dairy diseases and seasonal milk price fluctuations. However she remains optimistic that she will make tremendous improvements for her family with her second loan.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Phillemon

texts.en:
Phillemon is 53 years old, married to Elizabeth, and supports two of her children. He is in the brick-selling business, which he started 15 years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 20,000, which he will use to buy materials for brick-making. The profit he earns will help him repay his loan and expand his business. 

He dreams of seeing his business grow.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Jonafel

texts.en:
For over 3 years in Dimalco, Bonifacio, Jonafel, a 36-year-old married mother of 3 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products. She earns about 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Jonafel joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo (powdered milk mix), shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry works hard to support her family. Terry is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Terry is borrowing PHP 1,400 through NWTF to buy an envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings.

Terry is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 26 years old and married with two children. She sells clothes in a competitive environment to earn a living. She has engaged herself in this business for one year and has employed one person. Anne also depends on her husband's salary for the upkeep of her family. She dreams of owning rental houses in the future and operating a wholesale business. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is 45 years old. She sells different cooking oils such as vegetable cooking oil and palm oil. She has been doing this business for the past 18 years. She plans to use the loan for buying more cooking oil to sell. With the profits from the business, she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is 46 years old and lives in a rural village in a rural province. He is married and the father of two children ages 19 and 20. He sells the animals he raises. Elman has been in this line of work for 20 years. Also, he wants to increase the number of animals to start selling milk products and be at least the average level of farmer. 

Elman is requesting a loan from VisionFund for 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) to buy feed for his animals. He believes that this loan will allow him to earn more money, and his children to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. She describes herself as patient and innovative. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as margarine, sugar, salt, bread, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located beside a busy road and her primary customers are local residents. 

Florah describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more daily use items for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will venture into a grocery and beauty salon business.

loans.use: to buy more daily-use items

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose, tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Jose, tiene su propio taller de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas y mototaxis. Lo estableció hace dos años en un local alquilado. Anteriormente trabajaba en un taller de este rubro y fue allí donde aprendió muy bien  este oficio. El está solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar herramientas (juego de llaves)que necesita y los aditivos como aceites, grasas y otros para darle un mejor servicio al cliente, y tener a sus clientes satisfechos por el trabajo realizado. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a su madre en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Jose, age 21, lives in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro.  Jose has his own motorcycle maintenance and repair shop.  He established it in a rented location two years ago.  He previously worked in a shop in this trade, and that is where he learned this occupation very well.

He is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy tools (set of wrenches) that he needs and additives like oils, grease, and others to give the customer better service.  He will also do this so that his customers are satisfied with the work he does.  

His goal is to improve his house and to give his mother all the help she needs.

loans.use: to buy tools (set of wrenches) and additives like oil and grease to repair motorcycles in order to give his customers good service.

loans.name: Yaneth Maria

texts.es: Yaneth con su anterior credikiva compró víveres, productos de aseo ropa de baño, calzado y vestidos en mayor volumen que al que estaba acostumbrada y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. En la actualidad sus ventas se incrementaron y tienen nuevos pedidos, por eso está acudiendo a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará   víveres, calzado y ropa femenina que son los artículos que han pedido en su preventa. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “ Muy agradecida con esas personas que desinteresadamente nos han ayudado para sacar adelante nuestros pequeños negocios. “
texts.en: Yaneth used a past Kiva loan to stock her retail business with wholesale supplies of merchandise--bathroom products, bathwear, footwear, etc.--that she was able to buy, in bulk, at a lower price than she had been paying up to then.  Her sales have grown and she has new orders now.  She is applying for a new Kiva loan that she will use to restock her business.  She asked that we pass along the following message to Kiva lenders: "I am very grateful that there are people who are willing to help me and other borrowers even though they haven't met us".

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Genara is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more piglets and feed.

Genara has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF and more recently through Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu is a widow with three children. She is 53 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Marichu owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 16 years and earns 10,000 Philippines pesoes (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Marichu has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2010. Marichu hopes to expand her farm someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 55 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband works as a farmer. 

With the loan she has applied for, Patricie plans to buy more beans and sorghum to sell in her business, which she has been working at for the past five years. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Susana is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Susana is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Genevieve requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and additional utensils for her food business.  She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Genevieve would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and additional utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.en: Ranokhon is 53 years old. She is married and has four children to whom she has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. Her husband is a teacher and has a small salary. It's for this reason that she, 12 years ago, began her own business of selling foods in her own cafe. Her cafe is in a school and that’s why all of her customers are pupils and teachers. Thanks to the good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had this business, her family's quality of life has been improving, now that her children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. She is asking for a loan to buy food items for her cafe. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for her cafe

loans.name: Zaragosa

texts.es:
La socia Zaragosa,  tiene 53 años de edad, es madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos, ella nació  en la  ciudad del Accha (Provincia de Paruro) pero vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un pequeño kiosko en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La socia Zaragosa solicita el préstamo para la compra de más golosinas como por ejemplo galletas, caramelos, chocolates, chicles, pasteles y otras cosas más. 

La socia Zaragosa pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE III” y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Zaragosa, is 53 years old.  She is father and mother to her four children.  She was born in the city of Accha (Paruro province) and lives in Cusco now.  She has a kiosk in Cusco where she operates her snack business.  She has owned the business for four years and says that it is doing very well because she's worked hard to make it successful.

Zaragosa is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with merchandise--cookies, candy, chocolates, gum, pastries, etc.--that she will resell.

Zaragosa is a member of the COMUZONE III community bank.  She says that she is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Wendell

texts.es: Wendell tiene 61 años de edad, es casado fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos. El socio sigue con la ocupación que es conductor de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco. Wendell ha estado en esta línea de trabajo desde hace 9 años pues trabaja todos los días.  Wendell requiere el préstamo para comprar su propio taxi porque actualmente alquila el taxi que conduce todos los días. Es su sueño del socio Wendell es tener su propio coche y se compromete hacer los pagos del  préstamo a  tiempo.
texts.en:
Wendell is 61 years old and married. The fruit of this beautiful relationship is 6 children. This communal bank member continues in the occupation of taxi driver in the city of Cusco. Wendell has been in this line of work for the last 9 years and he works every day. 

Wendell needs the loan to buy his own taxi, since he presently rents the taxi he drives every day. It is member Wendell's dream to have his own vehicle and he is committed to making his loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase his own taxi.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 39 years old. She sells beans and sorghum; she has spent eleven years in the business. She has requested a loan for adding more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 41 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jonalyn has been farming vegetables and rice for 3 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF and more recently through Kiva, to sustain her venture.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is from Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-age children. Hannah owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in schools and in the local community. Hannah has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 4,000 a month. Hannah joined PMPC in 2008. Hannah is requesting a new loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business. This will be her ninth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business

location.town: Dipolog-Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a business selling bananas in the Philippines.

Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 1,500 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Rosemarie is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a mother of two children, aged between seven and three years. She lives with her family in her rural home in Nyamira, South Rift Kenya where she carries out mixed farming for her family's upkeep. She has six years in active farming and currently produces mainly sugarcane and tea for the local market. She is also in the lumbering business with some trees being sourced from her farm

Doris has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow, at 50,000 KES, and to construct a dairy unit, at 20,000 KES, on her farm. She believes her milk output will improve her family income and living standards. Doris believes that Juhudi Kilimo loans are improving the livelihood of many smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy  a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000, through NWTF, to purchase additional ingredients for her frozen foods business. She has been in this business for 19 years. Ma. Gina earns additional income from her general store.

Ma. Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her frozen food business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
