Elizabeth is a 42-year-old widow with four children, aged 23, 20, 19, and 10 years old, respectively. She owns a salon, a business she has been doing for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested for a second loan of KES 20,000 to pay school fees for her child in high school. Her dream is to become a great entrepreneur as well as give her children the best education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child in high school.

loans.name: Saverine

texts.en:
Saverine is a 43-year-old mother of seven children aged between six and 26. She has been in the business of selling sorghum and beans for more than three years. 

Saverine has applied for a loan so that she can buy more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells flour, sugar, tea leaves, bread, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located along a busy road, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the stiff competition within the area. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more household items to resell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be  a large-scale farmer and an inspiration to other women in her hometown. Jane also does farming involving cattle and vegetables. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more household items to resell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 44 years old, widowed, and has six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from abaca weaving. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 53 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by hog raising in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 14,000, through NWTF, to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Julieta has been hog raising for 8 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia compró mercancía variada como ropa blusas, calzado, víveres toallas y sabanas, que vendió rápidamente y con ello logró reinvertir y esto fue gracias a Kiva, que le facilitó su  financiamiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, el que invertirá mercancías solicitadas por sus clientes, como bolsos, vestidos femeninos, calzado, ropa de cama etc. Su inversión tendrá éxito, porque está justificada en pedidos que ha tomado de sus mejores clientes en  su preventa. Ella dice a sus financiadores:  “Muy agradecida con los financiadores de Kiva y pido que nos sigan apoyando a nosotros los pequeños comerciantes, para hacer prósperos nuestros negocios.”
texts.en:
Nidia bought various merchandise like blouses, shoes, supplies, towels, and sheets.  They sold rapidly, and with this she managed to reinvest.  This was thanks to Kiva providing her loan.

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan.  She will use it to invest in merchandise that her customers request.  She will buy things like bags, women’s dresses, and bedding, etc.  Her investment will be successful because it is justified by the pre-sale orders she has taken from her best customers.

She says to her lenders, “I am very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  I ask that you continue supporting us, the people with small businesses, in order to make our businesses prosper.”

loans.use: to buy things like bags, women’s dresses, and bedding, etc. that her customers have requested.

loans.name: Juddy

texts.en: Juddy has been running a salon business to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to buy hair chemicals and a blow-dry machine. This helped her improve her business, and with the additional income, she paid school fees for her children. Juddy is requesting another loan of 100,000 KES to buy hair chemicals and two blow-dry machines.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and two blow-dry machines.

loans.name: Tito Richar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el  Sr. Richar; el socio continua dedicandose al negocio de elaboracion y venta de velas ,el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa en este negocio ,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,el socio a la vez continua trabajando en una empresa privada, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia. 

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para su negocio como parafina.
    
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sr. Richar, belongs to the UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO community bank in Huanchac, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Richar has operated a business, making and selling candles, for many years.  He operates the business with his wife and says that it is doing well because they have worked hard to make it successful.  Richar is also a salaried employee at a private company.  His income from his job and candle business are his means for supporting his family.

Richar is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies--parafin, for example--that he needs to carry on his candle business.
    
Richar says that he is grateful for your help and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his retail business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.es: Stella tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación y tiene un hijo, ella sigue  con la pequeña cafetería en la  que vende café, té y varios pasteles. Además, ella vende productos de belleza a una serie de diferentes clientes. Los artículos incluyen productos para el cabello, perfumes y productos de limpieza facial. En esta oportunidad Stella requiere el préstamo para comprar suministros de belleza como colonias y perfumes. Stella es una mujer muy trabajadora y se compromete a hacer todos los pagos del préstamo a tiempo.
texts.en: Stella, 29, and her husband have one child.  She still owns a small cafe where she sells coffee, tea and pastries.  She also operates a cosmetics sales business.  She buys merchandise--hair products, perfumes, etc.--and resells them to her customers.  Stella is applying for a loan that she will use to restock her business with colognes, perfumes and other merchandise.  Stella is a hard-working woman and committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Majorine

texts.en:
Majorine is 30 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past four years, Majorine has been working hard to manage her boutique, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Majorine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wider variety of clothes, and will help Majorine to generate greater profits and improve her way of living. Majorine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to be an excellent entrepreneur. 

Majorine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Majorine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothes.

loans.name: Jenily

texts.en:
Jenily is 33 years old and single. 

Jenily is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenily requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jenily has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jenily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Felecisimo

texts.en:
Felecisimo, a 50-year-old, is a married entrepreneur from Digson, Bonifacio. He has two children and is earning money from raising corn. He has had this business for almost 18 years now, and he earns 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

To improve business, he borrowed an amount of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he joined in 2010, to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de fabricacion y venta de velas,la socia tiene su taller donde fabrica las velas el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa,la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un local por el centro de la ciudad donde vende las velas a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como parafina.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Unidos para el Triunfo" communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.   Elizabeth continues with her business of making and selling candels.  She has a workshop where she makes the candles in her house.  She has been in this business for years.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business.

She has a place in the center of the city where she sells the candles to the customers who request them.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  This way she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan to purchase materials like paraffin for her business. 

Elizabeth thanks everyone who is part of making this dream possible in this way, and she pledges to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials like paraffin for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Carolina es originaria  de Cacahotan  en el Estado de Chiapas, México ,llegó hace 3 años a la Cd. de Monterrey Nuevo Leon buscando una mejor calidad de vida; para apoyaral ingreso familiar, Carolina con el apoyo de su esposo Juan estableció un negocio de bocadillos (snack) " Snack El Elote" el cual le ha resultado de gran apoyo para solventar los gastos generados para  la educacion de sus dos hijos Nacho de 9 años y Caro de 6 años; ella requiere un credito para fortalecerlo incrementando el volumen de mercacias para la venta .
De hecho no solo vende bocadillos y alimentos diversos, pues tambien experimentó en la venta de mochilas y bolsas de mano pues está ubicada muy cerca de una escuela entonces existe mucho flujo de señoras que llevan a la escuela a sus hijos  lo cual le ha resultado y quiere invertir tambien en ello pues esta muy cercano el regreso a clases y considera le ira muy bien en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carolina is from Cacahotan in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She arrived some 3 years ago in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, looking for a better quality of life and to improve family income.  

Carolina, with the help of her husband Juan, established a snacks business, “Snack El Elote,” which has been a great help in covering the expenses generated in educating their 2 children; Nacho who is 9 years old, and Caro aged 6. Carolina needs a loan to fortify her business, increasing the volume of merchandise she sells.

In fact, she not only sells snacks and diverse foods, she has also experimented with selling backpacks and hand bags. Carolina's location is very close to a school and there are many women passing by, taking their children to school. As a result, she also wants to invest in these additional items, since it is almost time for classes to resume and she believes new merchandise will be good for sales.

loans.use: to provide snacks to sell, and to buy backpacks and hand bags to sell as well.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 58 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Emerita has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to be used in purchasing feeds for her hog-fattening activity. 

Emerita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Emerita hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for 12 years.   She earns additional income from abaca weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is widowed, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Delia is borrowing PHP 1,400 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking for her family.

Delia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married mother of four children who are attending school. 

In order to generate the income that her household needs, she sells fish in one of the busy markets. Thanks to this business, she has been able to move her children ahead, providing them with a good quality of life. 

Since she has spent several years running this business, her customers know her, and this has enabled her to move ahead little by little and increasingly improve her sales. 

Looking to stock her business for the season when sales increase immeasurably, she has sought a loan to purchase more fish and cooking oil to invest in her business.

Her greatest dream is that her children have the possibility to succeed, thanks to this business.  As well, she aspires to be able to overcome her financial difficulties and achieve a better quality of life at home with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio se dedica al negocio de taller de mecanica como puertas,ventanas y escaleras,la socia hace trabajos de metales,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio de taller metalico,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de taller de mecanica.El socio solicita el credito para comprar metales y herramientas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Walter works at a workshop making doors, windows, and stairs.  He works with metals.  He works from 8:00am until 6:00pm.  He has worked at this metal shop for seven years.  His dream is to expand the shop.

He is asking for this loan to purchase metals and tools.  He is happy with the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase metals and tools.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, como aluminio, hierro entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha dado muy buena experiencia en las ventas, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas a donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por su excelente servicio y los buenos precios; Víctor es un hombre emprendedor dedicado a su labor siempre esta  dispuesto a salir adelante  buscando alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, como todo comerciante desea acrecentar su venta porque solo así aumentaran sus ganancias, quiere duplicar la inversión pero para ello necesita de un capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, aluminio, etc. Víctor Manuel tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel, 44, lives with his partner and his children.  He makes his living buying and selling scrap materials such as aluminum and iron among others things. His has been in this business for several years and this has given him very good experience in sales. He trades in all of the surrounding areas near where he lives and he has many customers that prefer him because of his excellent service and good prices. Victor is an enterprising man dedicated to his work. He is always looking to get ahead and for ways that will pave the way to success. 

Like every trader, he would like to increase his sales because this is the only way that his earnings will grow. He would like to double the investment in his business, but to do this he needs capital which is why he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy iron, aluminum, etc. Victor Manuel has good repayment references and ensures that he can pay off the debt. At the same time, he has faith that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron and aluminum wholesale for his business

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 71 years old, and he is married to Elizabeth, who is into subsistence farming to help fend for their family

Ernest has been in the business of selling poultry for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase poultry for resale. 

With the additional income, he plans to save some amount for future use and use the remaining amount to repay his loan. His dream is to venture into large scale poultry selling.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for resale.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida works hard to support her family. Leonida is married and has a banana retail business in the Philippines.

Leonida is borrowing 1,400 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Leonida is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married, and she has a sari-sari store business (a small convenience store) in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries items, such as curls, noodles, and soft-drinks, for her business.

Cecilia has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries items, such as curls, noodles, and softdrinks, for her store.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro, un joven emprendedor, originario de Estelí, padre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de bolis. El nos cuenta que el haber sido beneficiado por el crédito le fue de mucha ayuda y está muy agradecido pues logro materia prima para hacer  sus productos y el noto que entre más productos de consumo popular les ofrezcas a los clientes más te busca. El tiene una meta de poder comenzar una panadería pues cerca de su comunidad no cuentan con este tipo de negocio que son escasos y pocos los que ofrecen. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, aceite. Pues su propósito es comenzar a vender pan y vender bolis, tiene como meta progresar en la vida darle una  mejor calidad de vida a su familia y tener un negocio sostenible económicamente.
texts.en:
Pedro, an enterprising young man and a native of Esteli, is the father of three children. He is a merchant who sells “bolis” (frozen ice pops). He tells us that he benefited from the previous loan and that it was a great help and he is very grateful since he obtained the raw materials to make his products. He notes that the more popular consumption products he offers the more customers he has.

His goal is to be able to start a bakery since there are none in his community and stores in the area offer few such products. Consequently he is requesting a new loan to purchase flour, sugar, yeast and oil. His objective is to begin selling bread as well as “bolis”. He wants to succeed and give his family a better quality of life and have a business that is economically sustainable.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 45 years old and married with five children.  She works in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva.  Ruth has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 23 años de edad  y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en el cantón de Turrialba ubicado en la  provincia de Cartago. La ciudad de Cartago fue capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823, se caracteriza por tener un  relieve montañoso formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca, su clima es frío la mayoría del año consecuencia de los dos volcanes que posee llamados  Irazú y Turrialba.
Edwin trabaja a dos horas de su casa y le urge comprar un vehículo para trasladarse al lugar de trabajo, él usará el vehículo el  fin de semana transportando personas de una comunidad a otra y con esto obtendrá un dinero extra para ayudar más a su familia.
Actualmente Edwin desea obtener un microcrédito de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para la compra de dicho vehículo.
Edwin es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old and lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita in the Turrialba canton in the province of Cartago.  The city of Cartago was the capital of Costa Rica until 1823.  It is known for its mountainous landscape formed by two mountain ranges, the Central and the Talamanca.  The weather is cold the majority of the year because of the two nearby volcanoes, Irazú and Turrialba.

Edwin works two hours from his home and he needs to purchase a vehicle to get to the place where he works.  He will also use the vehicle on the weekends to transport people from one community to another so that he can earn extra money to help his family.  

Edwin is requesting a loan of 600,000 colones to purchase the vehicle.  He is a member of the El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba community bank, one of the 150 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to get to work and to use as a taxi on the weekends.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a recycled materials business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials.  In the future, Feliciana would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She  buys and sells rice in the Philippines, and she also earns income from selling frozen products and raising pigs. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Susan has sustained her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 71 years old, and she lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed, with two children.
 
Ella has a hog-fattening business, and she earns PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to be used in purchasing feed for her hogs. 

Ella has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Ella hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fatten her hogs.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 53 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erma has been in this business for eight years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.  She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo & groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Illimine

texts.en:
Illimine is 32 years old. She owns a bar, and she has been running the business for the past six years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES ,la socia Adelaida tiene 41 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es casada,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de joyeria,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende su mercaderia como aretes,pulseras,collares hechos en plata ,la socia vende por el centro de la ciudad a sus clientes que le solicitan como turistas,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,siendo de esta manera que la socia poya economicamente a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como pulidores y plata.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Los Diamantes Communal Bank.  The member, Adelaida, is 41 years old, has one son and is married. She alternates her daily activities with her business, selling jewelry. The member has spent years in this business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. 

The member sells her merchandise, such as earrings, bracelets and necklaces made of silver, in the downtown area of the city. She sells to customers like tourists. The member is a responsible person, eager to continue working for her family since this is a way she can support her family economically.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as a polisher and silver. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as a polishing machine and silver.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old single man who has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables for the last 21 years. He was very young when he started working because he needed to help his parents make a living. He missed having a childhood and has not married because he wants to make sure that his income can cover all of his future family's expenses. 

In 2000, Ali opened his own shop and is doing really well. He hopes to expand it so that he can make plans for his future. He is a hard worker with a good reputation, and puts a lot of effort into satisfying his customers and winning their loyalty. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy more fruits, vegetables and special seasonal products to sell to his customers. This is his second loan from Al Majmoua, and he paid his first one back completely and on time.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and seasonal items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Perlie Grace

texts.en: Perlie Grace is a 31-year-old resident of Bolinsong, Bonifacio. She provides for her 2 children from the small income of 20,000 PHP she earns monthly from her piggery business. She has been running this business for 10 years as an aid to the income her husband brings home. Since 2010 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies.  Perlie Grace wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is widow, with one child. She is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lorenza is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12  years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for piglets, feeds, and vitamins.

Lorenza has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Lorenza hopes to have enough savings for her family.

loans.use: To pay for piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 39 years old and married, with seven children.  Three of her children are in school.  Mary Ann works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Ann runs a variety store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years.  She sells a variety of items, such as soft-drinks, bread, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is 57 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has worked in the field of animal husbandry for more than three years and is one of the best and successful businesswomen in her local market. She buys cattle, cares of them for two or three months and then sells them to people who live in her area. She has done well because her cattle are fat and attract a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan for 7,000 somoni to buy more young cattle to raise. Her goal is to provide her family with a higher standard of living. She promises to make payments on time and is eager to have your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children. To make a living, she raises and harvests corn. She has been in this business for 13 years and earns PHP 10,300 per month. She is requesting for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer to increase the size of her harvest. She will reinvest her earnings into her business so that she can eventually double her returns.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Haytgul

texts.ru: Хайтгул жительница города Дангара. Она разведена. Ей 33 года. У нее один ребенок. Ее сын учится в средней школе. Хайтгул предоставляет услугу. Она занимается шитьем у себя дома. В этой области она пять лет. Хайтгул просит кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, так как она берет учениц.
texts.en: Haytgul lives in the city of Dangara. She is 33 years old, divorced, and has one child. Her son is in high school. Haytgul provides a service; she runs a sewing business out of her home. She has been doing this type of work for five years. Haytgul has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because she is taking on a student.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, bread, candy, drinks and other items for her home-based general store

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has been in the welding business for the past four years and earns a monthly income of KES. 7,000. He is requesting his first loan, for KES. 20,000, from KADET LTD. He plans to use this loan to buy welding metals and a welding machine. He will use the profits he expects to earn to repay this loan and improve his business. His dream for the future is to manage his business so well that he can ensure good profits.

loans.use: to buy metals and a welding machine for his business.

loans.name: Lady Rose

texts.en: Lady Rose is 26 years old, married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 from NWTF to buy items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for five years and earns most of her income by selling items such as soap, food, soft drinks and groceries.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a local eatery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a butcher shop. Vilma is borrowing 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mahutin 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN 2 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie Kottin, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie Kottin est âgée de 59 ans et est mariée à Idelphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marie Kottin et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Marie Kottin n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une vingtaine d’années, Marie Kottin vend des charbons de bois et des vins de bois à son domicile. Marie Kottin s’approvisionne auprès des revendeurs. Cette activité lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille sans grande difficulté. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Marie Kottin n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Marie Kottin et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN 2 sollicitent ensemble un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les cinq premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUTIN 2 group is made up of three people who are friends living in the same neighbourhood in Benin. The representative of the group, who is named Marie Kottin, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the sixth time that the group requests financial support from ALIDé in order to enhance their activity. Marie Kottin is 59 years old and married to a certain Idelphonse. The couple has four children some of whom attend school at their expense. Marie Kottin and her husband live together with their children and share the various family expenses. Marie Kottin did not go to school. For about 20 years she has been selling charcoal and wine from her home. Marie Kottin buys her products from resellers. This business enables her to meet her family's needs without too much difficulty. Her customers' needs are becoming increasingly large and in view of her limited means, Marie Kottin can no longer satisfy the demand. Due to this situation and because they have limited resources, Marie Kottin and the other members of the MAHUTIN 2 group, request a loan from ALIDé. The five previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and palm wine.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es: Claudia María de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hija y su nieta en casa propia; ella posee una sala de belleza donde ofrece excelentes servicios, como cortes, planchados, tintes, lavado de cabello entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia en una zona muy  frecuentada, tiene muchos años de experiencia en el rubro y eso le permite realizar un excelente trabajo, es muy conocida en toda la zona ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad de su labor, el buen servicio pero sobre todo por los precios accesibles; Claudia es una mujer activa, trabajadora y muy luchadora desea alcanzar cada uno de sus sueños porque para ella su vida es una lucha constante en el camino donde se abrirá puertas al éxito; una de sus mayores metas es acrecentar el negocio y ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aprovechar para la inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos, tijeras, tintes, shampoo, etc. Claudia María tiene buenas referencias de pago, tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria, 45 years old, lives with her life’s companion, her daughter and granddaughter in their own house. She has a beauty salon where she offers excellent services such as haircuts, straightening, tints and shampoos, among others. Her shop is located in her home in a busy area. She has had many years of experience in this business and that enables her to do excellent work. She is very well known throughout the area and has many customers who prefer her because of the quality of work, good service and reasonable prices she provides.

Claudia is a very active and hardworking woman who struggles to achieve each one of her dreams because for her life is a perpetual struggle to open doors on the road to success. One of her greatest goals is to increase her business and now that she has increased demand she wants to invest, however she needs capital. Therefore she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will enable her to purchase cosmetics, scissors, tints, shampoo, etc. Claudia Maria has a good payment history and is certain she will be able to pay off the debt within the established time period and also give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, scissors, tints, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Conegonda

texts.en: This time, Conegada is applying for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (Php) to buy ingredients for her food business. The hog-raising that she previously funded through Kiva and NWTF continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Subon

texts.ru: Субон мужчина в возрасте, но не смотря на свой возраст он не сидит сложа руки.Всю свою жизнь он занимается откормом скота так как не имеет образования.В этом году он уже берет второй кредит,на первый кредит он приобрел несколько голов скота и получил очень хороший доход.Поэтому Субон решил сразу взять очередной кредит и купить пару коров а также корма для них.Он очень благодарит нашу организацию за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Subon is not a young man, but despite his age he does not sit around idle. Having no formal education, he has been involved in raising livestock for his entire life. This year he is taking out a second loan; with the first loan he bought several heads of livestock and turned a very good profit. So Subon decided to immediately take out a another loan and buy a pair of cows and some feed. He is very grateful to MDO Arvand, LLC, for it assistance and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: María Delmy

texts.es: María Delmy de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas Jacqueline y Nanci; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con este trabajo y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener los mejores resultados, su  negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y frecuentada por las personas de la comunidad, es muy conocida pues sus tortillas son las mas ricas y siempre están calientitas, tiene mucha clientela y la buscan por su excelente calidad, buenos precios y sobre todo el servicio mas rápido; María es una mujer luchadora, entregada a su labor, su mas grande meta es alcanzar el triunfo y se esfuerza día con día para ganarse ese futuro mas próspero; en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar su inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc. María Delmy tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de otras instituciones y se hace responsable del pago completo de la deuda, y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Delmy, 36, lives together with her partner and two children, Jacqueline and Nanci. She works selling tortillas. She has been doing this for several years and she has gained a lot of experience which allows her to get better results. Her business is located in a very strategic zone, frequented by members of the community. It is well known since her tortillas are the most delicious and they are always hot. She has a lot of customers, and they look for her because of the excellent quality, good prices, and above all, fastest service.

 María is a courageous woman, dedicated to her work. Her greatest goal is to achieve success and she strives day after day to obtain this more prosperous future. In recent months, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage and increase her investment, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she's applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, which allows her to buy wholesale corn, propane gas, etc. María Delmy has good payment references from other institutions and she is responsible for the complete payment of the debt. She also hopes that she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, propane gas

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 42 years old and married to Mentrine.  They are blessed with two children aged 15 and 10 years.  Philip has a car-washing business. He has been in operation for the last two years, earning KES 6,000 monthly.
	
This is Philip’s fifth loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying his previous loans.  He will use the KES 60,000 loan to pay for detergents, washing materials and his workers’ wages.  He plans to re-invest the anticipated profits into his car-washing business. His dream is to upgrade the tools of his trade so as to work more efficiently and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for detergents, washing materials and his workers’ wages.

loans.name: Corsine

texts.en:
Corsine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Corsine has repaid her previous loan, so NWTF is listing Corsine's business profile again in support of her new efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Andrea del Carmen tiene 40 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..
Es integrante de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Andrea se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arroz, maíz además se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cerdos. Las compras lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. El sueño es sembrar más héctares de terreno.

En el tiempo libre le gusta a los quehaceres familiares.
texts.en:
Andrea del Carmen is forty years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas canton of the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA (Fighting for the Same Cause), which is located in the precinct La Primavera in the Ventanas canton. The people of Ventanas make their living through short-cycle farming planting corn and rice.

Andrea makes her living in agriculture planting corn, beans, and rice in addition to raising chicken and pigs. She makes purchases in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, nutrients, and fertilizers for the crops. The economic support of the loan will help her supply her necessities. Her dream is to plant more hectares of land.

In her free time she likes to do family chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, nutrients, and fertilizers for the crops

loans.name: Ana  Luisa

texts.es: Ana, 29 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, casada, madre de 2 hijas , de oficio comerciante se dedica a vender ropa interior. Ella comenzó a trabajar en el mundo del comercio cuando tenía 25 años de edad, comenzó vendiendo enchiladas, plátanos, queso conforme fue avanzando ahorro y inicio a invertir para comprar y vender ropa interior , mercadería variada. Hoy en día tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación donde vende ropa y artículos variados. Su expectativa es ir ampliando su negocio poco a poco surtiéndolo de mercadería variada. Es por ello que solicito el crédito para comprar ropa interior para vender.  Su sueño es tener una miscelánea donde venda de todo tipo de ropa y alimentos , artículos para el hogar.
texts.en: Ana is 29 years old and resides in the city of Teustepe, Boaco municipality.  She is married and has 2 daughters.  She is a merchant and sells undergarments.  She began working in the world of commerce when she was 25 years old; she started by selling enchiladas, bananas, cheese, and as she progressed she saved and started buying undergarments and other miscellaneous merchandise for re-sell.  She now runs her small business out of her home and sells miscellaneous goods and undergarments.  Her goal is to expand her business and stock it with a variety of miscellaneous goods.  She is soliciting this loan to purchase undergarments for re-sell.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell all types of clothing, food, articles for the home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.en: Jeannine, aged 50, is a widow and a mother of three children.  She sells beans and sorghum, and has been in this business for 14 years. With her loan, she plans to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en: Peninnah sells cereals to earn a living. She had previously received a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to buy maize, beans and rice. This helped her to improve her business, and with the additional income she was able to support her children. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a wall unit.

loans.use: To buy a wall  unit

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 50 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his clinic, which treats animals and people. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine like panadol, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Moses hopes that in the future he will be a good entrepreneur. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine like panadol

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 52 years old, and she lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married  with seven children, four of them currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Anna has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soda, beer, rice, sugar, and other household staples. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda, beer, and sugar to sell.  It will help Anna to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. 

Anna hopes that in the future, she will be able to be a successful entrepreneur.   She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anna, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soda, beer, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ma.fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima is 58 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Fatima has a sari-sari store business (a small convenience store) in the Philippines.   She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, detergent and other grocery items to stock.

Ma. Fatima has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Fatima would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, detergent, and other grocery items.

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es: María del Transito de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su hijo Roberto; ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, leche, pan, huevos, pollo, entre otros, es la tienda  mas surtida  y mas conocida por las personas de la comunidad, tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere por la excelente calidad de los productos, los buenos precios y sobre todo el excelente servicio, adicional a esta actividad María se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado bovino y al cultivo de maíz pues esto le ayuda a completar los gastos del hogar y a obtener ganancias para futuras inversiones; es una mujer entregada a su labor, vivaz, y luchadora siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presenten y que le den la oportunidad de ganar un futuro mejor haciendo lo que le gusta, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar la tienda pero necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos, bebidas, pollo, jabones, etc. María del Transito tiene buen record de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Transito, 54, lives with her son Roberto. She has a store where she sells essentials like beans, milk, bread, eggs, and chicken, among other things. It is the most well-known store by the people in the community and the best-stocked. She has lots of experience with sales and has gained many regular customers who prefer her for the excellent quality of the products, the good prices, and above all, the excellent service.  

In addition to this activity, María works raising and selling cattle and growing corn. This helps her to cover home expenses and earn income for future investments. She is a woman who is dedicated to her work, lively, and courageous. She is always waiting for new opportunities to present themselves and give her the chance to make a better future doing what she enjoys. Like all good store-keepers, she wants to grow the store, but she need the money to back it. This is why she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to buy grains, sweets, bread, eggs, drinks, chicken, soaps, etc. María del Transito has a good record of payment and she is responsible for paying off the loan. She also has faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grains, sweets, bread, eggs, drinks, chicken, and soaps.

loans.name: Nodari

texts.en:
Nodari is 55 years old and lives in a small village in the Mtskheta district. He has a large family and lives with his wife, mother and three sons, who have their own families as well.  Nodari’s mother has a retirement pension. His wife works as a baker and earns a monthly income. His sons are employed and have monthly salaries as well. The family successfully runs an agricultural business. In particular, Nodari has two greenhouses, where tomatoes and greens are grown. He is also involved in dairy farming. Nodari owns a milking cow and produces cheese, which is sold locally. He is a very hard-working man, with a wealth of experience in his work.
	
He has requested a loan to purchase livestock. He will expand his dairy business and will be able to get more milk and produce more cheese. With this loan the family’s income will increase and their living conditions will improve.  Nodari awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 50 years old and married with four children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 35 year old married woman and a mother of two young children aged nine and four years. They live in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the cell phone reloading business for more than a year now. She is a hardworking woman, willing to give her best for the benefit of her family. 
	
Leonora is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional cell phone minutes to sell and to pay the school expenses of her children. This will enable her to cater to more customers in her workplace. Leonora dreams of expanding her business to generate more income, which is necessary for the family. She also hopes to keep sending her children to school so they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional cell phone minutes to sell and to pay the school expenses of her children

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 51 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa works hard to support her family. Santa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Santa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Santa has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Santa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Annie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Annie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 31 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 5 years, Dennis has been working hard to manage his small business where he tailors and sells pre-made clothes. 

To help expand his business, Dennis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials and a sewing machine, and will help Dennis to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Dennis hopes that in the future he will be able to have a better and successful life. 

Dennis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jacqwiline

texts.en:
Jacqwiline is a resident of Nkubu where she has been practicing farming and majorly dairy farming for twenty-five years. Her other farm produce includes cereals like maize and poultry.She is a divorcee with four adult children and lives with some of her grandchildren, with her sale of produce to the local market meeting her family needs.

She says the loan of 42,000 KES she is requesting from Juhudi Kilimo will help her add another dairy cow to her farm. Her focus is to have a farm of five good breeds of dairy cows in order to raise enough income and educate her grandchildren.

She mentions pests and diseases and high cost of farm labour as the daunting challenges in the farming business. She ranks Juhudi Kilimo as the best micro-finance institution.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Annabeth

texts.en:
Annabeth is 25 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Annabeth has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail for a year and also earns an income from rice retailing and a general store.

Annabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains, meats, dairy products, vegetables, and drinks.

loans.name: Analyne

texts.en:
Analyne is 38 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Analyne works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for boxes of assorted fish. 

Analyne has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Analyne hopes to to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: To pay for boxes of assorted fish

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert  is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 6 years to 11 years. He describes himself as a determined man. He operates a retail store  where he sells items such as sodas, flour, tea leaves, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Gilbert describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area . He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. His business goal is to run a wholesale retail business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful man and will educate his children with profits made.

loans.use: to buy daily use items for resale

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Muzaffar is 28-year-old man who is married and has two children. His wife is a kind woman who tries to help him with his business. They must comfort their children with all modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes his children more progressive. 

Muzaffar tries to provide them with a better quality of life; that’s why 12 years ago he began own business baking bread. He sells bread in his bakery shop and has a lot of customers. He wants to develop his business further but he needs to buy flour and coal to bake more bread. He promises to make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flour and coal to bake more bread

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28, single, and lives with a family of eight members, four of whom are employed. 

Akil owns a pool hall. He established his business in 2004 and he has now two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2400 as a youth loan to renovate the shop and buy an air-conditioner. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and buy an air-conditioner

loans.name: Alotoalome 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOTOALOME 1 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et s’approvisionnant au même endroit. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jésugnon ELisabeth, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Jésugnon ELisabeth est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Barthélémy et est mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à sa charge. Jésugnon ELisabeth a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs dix ans que Jésugnon ELisabeth exerce comme activité, la coiffure. De façon secondaire à cette activité, Jésugnon ELisabeth vend des mèches et des cartes de recharges. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Jésugnon ELisabeth s’approvisionne au Nigéria et  dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jésugnon ELisabeth désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Jésugnon ELisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  ALOTOALOME 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The ALOTOALOME 1 group is made up of three people who are friends and who buy their supplies at the same place. The leader of the group, named Jésugnon Elisabeth is the one with her hand raised on the photo. This is the first time that this group requests financial support from ALIDé in order to enhance the standard of their activity. Jésugnon Elisabeth is married to a driver named Barthélémy and has three children, some of whom attend school at their expense. Jésugnon Elisabeth went to school very little. She has been a hairdresser for about ten years. On a secondary basis, she also sells locks of hair and telephone recharge cards. Thanks to this, she is able to provide for her family's needs without too much difficulty. Jésugnon Elisabeth buys her stock in Nigeria and in a town in Benin. Hoping to improve her capacity to satisfy her customers, Jésugnon Elisabeth would like to increase her stock. In order to achieve this, with the other members of the ALOTOALOME 1 group, Jésugnon Elisabeth requests a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy locks of hair and hairdressing products.

loans.name: Gratia

texts.en:
Gratia is 51 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they have six children, ages between 15 and 28 years. 

She sells beans and sorghum, and she has been in the business for eight years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 20 years old.  He is married but doesn’t have children. He lives with a family of five members, two of whom are employed. 

Ali has a mobile-phones shop. He established his business in 2008, and he now has one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,400 as Youth loan to renovate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his mobile-phones shop.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos alimenticios fritos y también ofrece el servicio de telecomunicaciones por minutos; él vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 12 años, por quienes se esmera trabajando, para que tengan un futuro prometedor. Su experiencia comercial de  20 años, le ha permitido sacar adelante lo que se propone,  y la actividad comercial para él es un proceso muy propio de su naturaleza, pues desde sus 8 años de edad se inclinó por ella e hizo ejercicios de ventas; así fue que cuando adulto  inició su propio negocio en el año 2004, tal como su sueño se lo indicó y aprovechando el auge de los teléfonos celulares,  inició el servicio de llamadas, cobrando el valor de los minutos a celulares; poco a poco logró que a su alrededor, los vecinos accedieran a sus relaciones comerciales   y  combinó esta actividad con la venta  de productos fritos, para lograr dos fuentes de ingresos y aumentar cada vez mas su capital de trabajo y con ello mas dinero en su haber. En la actualidad  realiza sus ventas  directamente al consumidor final, vendiéndole de contado, e iniciando su horario laboral desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 10 de la noche. Sus principales clientes fijos,  son los habitantes del sector donde habita y tiene su negocio y transeúntes que hacen diariamente su recorrido hacia otras zonas. Su meta es seguir creciendo en infraestructura de clientes, aumentar sus ventas y obtener mucho más utilidades; pero su mayor desafío es el insuficiente efectivo para incrementar sus ventas, aunque exista una gran demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos en mayor volumen y de contado para ganar descuentos y disminuir los costos de sus productos y poco a poco fundamentando un futuro de mucho mas bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is forty years old and makes his living making and selling fried foods and offering telecommunication services by the minute. He lives with his wife and two children, ages three and twelve years, for whom he works very hard so that they can have a promising future.

Juan's twenty years of commercial experience have allowed him to achieve the goals he has set for himself. Commercial activity comes naturally to him, and since he was eight years old he has been inclined toward it and has practiced making sales. So it was that as an adult he started his own business in 2004, just as his dream had indicated. He took advantage of the rise of cell phones to start a calling service, charging the cost of cell phone minutes. Little by little he reached the point that in his neighbors in the area acceded their commercial relations to him. He combined this with the sale of fried products in order to achieve two streams of income and to contually augment his work capital and and in this way to increase his assets.

He currently sells directly to the final consumer, making cash transactions. He starts his work day around seven in the morning and works until ten at night. His main regular clients are residents of the area where he lives and has his business as well as passers-by who come through daily on their way to other areas. His goal is to continue growing his infrastructure and clientele, to increase sales, and obtain more utilities. His main challenge is that he lacks funds to grow his sales, although a great demand exists. This is why he is seeking a loan, the first financing that he has done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this, he will buy supplies in greater volume and he will do so in cash in order to get discounts and diminish the costs of his products, little by little building a future of greater well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make fried snacks in greater volume

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 55 years old. She sells beer and has been in the business for six years. She wants to use a loan for adding more beer in her business. With the profits from the business, she will renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a  beautiful single lady who lives in a rental house in the town of Kaloleni. She aims to become financially stable to improve her living status. To generate income, she owns and manages a tailoring store, making clothes and repairing old and torn clothes. Due to the high cost of living, she needs to increase the income to cover her needs.

In this regard, Rukia aims to improve her business to earn sufficient income. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan for KES 20,000 to buy clothing materials for her business. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to work out her plan and is hoping that she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Anthony has been working hard to manage his depot where he sells soda, beer and mineral water. 

To help expand his business, Anthony has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda, water and beer to stock in his shop, and will help Anthony to generate greater profits and grow his income which will help to sustain his family. Anthony hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a larger store. 

Anthony is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anthony who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soda, water and beer for his shop

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en:
Potenciana is married with three children. Potenciana is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.  
  
Potenciana is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer.
                                              
Potenciana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Potenciana hopes to harvest corn.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer

loans.name: Kulusum

texts.en:
Kulusum  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (her mother). She operates a food stall at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last year. She works six days a week. 

Kulusum has requested a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of bananas and sweet and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major expenses include  paying for utilities and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 43 years old and lives in Kaspi district. She is married and has a 22-year-old daughter. Manana’s husband works as a senior technician and gets a monthly salary. Manana and her daughter run their agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where tomatoes and garlic are grown. Manana is also involved in dairy farming. She has 2 milk cows. Manana and her daughter milk the cows and produce cheese. They sell cheese locally. Manana is very hard-working woman and very well known in the area for her big heart and friendliness toward others. 

Manana requested a loan to build a cattle-shed. With this loan she will purchase building materials. Manana plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle-shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the building is expanded, Manana will purchase livestock and she will be able to double production and sale of cheese. The income of the family will significantly increase. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a cattle-shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for marketing and the creation of a website

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: After Miguel established a successful retail business in Bogota, Columbia, he decided to bring his business model to Los Angeles, California in order to fulfill the retail consumer needs.  Kora Fashion Trading offers a wide range of clothing for women and carries ready to wear designer lines of casual and contemporary apparel and handbags.  Miguel is seeking a loan of $5,000 in order to purchase inventory such as jeans, shirts, dresses, handbags and other accessories.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, hand bags, and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 2 vehicles

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 43-year-old married man. He has four children ranging in age from 10 to 25 years old. He describes himself to be an aggressive man . He operates a carpentry business where he sells furniture such as chairs, tables etc. He has been involved in this business for more than seven years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a marketplace and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of timber. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more timber for making furniture for his customers. His business goal is to venture into a new business of a distributing warehouse in Maua within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman. This is Charles' first loan.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Trinidad has been in this business for 15 years. Trinidad earns more income from her coffee shop.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Dori’s Beauty Salon has been in business for 16 years with a reputation for having loyal clients and referrals. Dori’s Beauty Salon provides haircuts for both genders and specializes in unique hair styles and make-up for all occasions. Not only does the owner of Dori’s Beauty Salon, Ernestina, style hair and makeup, but she also sells hair products to clients and other salons. Ernestina will use the funds to help pay for rent and styling products for her salon.

loans.use: to pay for rent and styling products

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and lives in Adorable, Jimenez. Lilia is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Lilia has a business selling snacks in the local community.Lilia earns about PHP 1000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.  

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Lilia would like to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Ma.nueda

texts.en:
Ma. Nueda is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma.Nueda is 36 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Nueda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Nueda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ma. Nueda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis  is a 67-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 18 years to 30 years. He describes himself to be a persistent man . He operates a farm where he sells tomatoes and paw paws. He has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs one staff member. His business is located within a residential area  and his primary customers are local residents. 

Francis describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent lack of rain in the area, leading to crops drying up before maturity . He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy tomatoes and paw paw seeds. His business goal is to be a supplier of vegetables in his home town  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds of tomatoes and paw paw (papaya)

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
