Fridah is a mother of one child, age thirteen, and she has been in mixed farming in her rural home in Nkubu for twenty years. With the sale of her cereals, like French beans, she helps to meet her family's basic needs. She owns a retail business as well for additional income.

Fridah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to setup a zero-grazing unit for her dairy cows. She says this will help her in managing her dairy cows' feedings, which is a significant cost to her business, especially during dry seasons. She will use the income to give her child a better education. She aims to have at least five dairy cows.

Fridah likes Juhudi Kilimo's loan services, especially because they process their loans quickly.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric, 24 years old and single, supports his elderly parents as well as his younger siblings. He has been operating a motorbike transport business in the Narok area for two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 13,000.

Eric will use his first loan of KES. 75,000 from KADET LTD to purchase his own motorbike, with the anticipated additional profits going toward the school fees of his siblings. He dreams of improving his family's living standards and owning a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Makaseb

texts.en:
Makaseb, who lives in Iraq, is 53 years old, married and has four children. His wife works and contributes to the family income. Makaseb owns a car repair shop, a business he established in 2006 that now has three employees. He has good experience in this field and enjoys a good reputation in his local community.

Makaseb is requesting a loan of $2700 to buy a generator and a specialized machine for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a specialized machine for his work.

loans.name: Midoukpo 3 Group

texts.fr: MIDOUKPO 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent les mêmes activités et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Solange (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un infirmier du nom de Théodore. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Solange et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Solange n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Solange exerce la coiffure dans sa région. Parallèlement, Solange vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux. Solange exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Solange s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Solange sollicite un troisième crédit ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIDOUKPO 3. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: MIDOUKPO 3 is a group of three people, whose members have the same profession and belong to the same loan group. The leader of the group, Solange (whose hand is raised on the photo), is 34 years old and is married to a nurse called Theodore. The couple has two children, of whom one attends school at their expense. Solange and her husband live together with their children. Solange did not go to school. Solange has been a hairdresser in her region for about 10 years. On a parallel basis, she sells locks of hair and hairdressing products. Solange works in this profession with passion, which is what enables her to provide for herself and her children. She buys her stock in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, Solange requests a third loan with the other members of the MIDOUKPO 3 group. This loan will enable them to more adequately satisfy the demands of their clientele and make more profits. The previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy locks of hair and hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for makeup inventory, equipment, and rent

loans.name: Lauran

texts.en: Lauran established NuHome Technologies in 2009 in order to provide state of the art low-voltage electronic solutions. The company specializes in high-end home and audio designs, providing exceptional quality installation services for electronic systems such as audio/video systems, surveillance systems, automatic lighting systems, etc.  Lauran seeks a loan of $5,000 to design a new portfolio and build 150 high-quality miniature product samples. The remainder of the loan will be used for marketing in order move past the niche market and expand to a new wave of clients.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising

loans.name: Lara

texts.en: AYM Alliance is a professional-level engineering and information technology recruiting firm, specializing in direct hire for consulting and staffing services. AYM Alliance’s customers range from manufacturing companies, aerospace, medical devices, green energy, plastics, health care, commercial, military and digital services. AYM Alliance conducts full interviews in order to screen potential candidates and consultation. Lara is seeking a loan of $10,000 in order to hire two additional recruiters and account managers.

loans.use: to hire new employees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more inventory

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 32 years old and married to Maurine. Together they have two children. He has been in the retail shop business for four years earning KES 5,000 monthly. 

This is Caleb's first loan of KES 15,000 with KADET LTD and plans on using the amount to purchase bar soaps, sugar, rice and cooking oil for resale.

With the anticipated profits, he will pay his child's school fees and use the remaining amount to run the business. His hope is that his retail shop grows to a bigger shop to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase bar soap, sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Nkubu. She is a farmer and has a mixed farm that produces tea, fruits, and vegetables for the local market. She has been in farming for fifteen years. She has three children, and all of them are school-going.

Beatrice has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to buy dairy goats. She says she will use the income to pay for the education of her children and improve their living standards. She aspires to expand her farm through the purchase of more parcels of land.

She mentions the high cost of farm supplies as a major challenge coupled with pests and diseases. She says that Juhudi Kilimo's strength is its fast loan processing.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.en:
Suhrobjon, 22 years old, is married to a beautiful woman who sells ice cream. His parents and brothers live with them. A hardworking young man trying to improve his family's living conditions, Suhrobjon began his taxi business five years ago, and thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers.

In order to develop his business, Suhrobjon is requesting a loan to buy a new minibus. This will enable him to provide better service and increase his income, thereby allowing him to offer his parents and wife a better quality of life and improved opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy a minibus.

loans.name: Adjeniya 2 Group

texts.fr: ADJENIYA 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent les mêmes activités et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La présidente du groupe, Alphonsine Mahoussi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Moussiliou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Alphonsine Mahoussi et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants. Alphonsine Mahoussi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a vingt ans environs que Alphonsine Mahoussi fait le commerce des céréales (farine de manioc, maïs) et des produits de mercerie de façon secondaire à son domicile. Alphonsine Mahoussi s’approvisionne au Nigéria et dans sa région. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Alphonsine Mahoussi sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les membres du groupe ADJENIYA 2. Ce crédit lui servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
ADJENIYA 2 is a three-person group. The members are all in the same type of business and they all belong to same revolving credit group. 

The president of the group, Alphonsine Mahoussi (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 51 and married to a mason named Moussiliou. The couple has two dependent children - both of whom went to school. Alphonsine Mahoussi and her husband live together with their two children. Alphonsine Mahoussi did not go to school. 

Alphonsine Mahoussi has been selling grains (cassava flour, corn) for about 20 years. She also sells dry goods out of her own as a secondary source of income. Alphonsine Mahoussi buys her supplies in Nigeria and in her region. This business allows her to meet her children's needs as well as her own.

In order to satisfy her clients, Alphonsine Mahoussi and the members of the group ADJENIYA 2 are asking for their first loan. This credit will allow her to increase the inventory of her products.

loans.use: to buy dry goods.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 30 years old, married, and has four children. One of his parents lives with him. He is the only provider for his family.

Ali owns a carpentry business. He makes doors, bedroom closets, and other items. He established his business in 2007, and now he has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,300 as a youth loan to pay his business' annual rent. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To pay his business' annual rent

loans.name: Dylan

texts.en: Dylan Kendall Home Accessories was launched in 2011. The company is founded on the belief that play is a lifestyle choice and that our homes should make us happy. The launch line, The Efeet Collection, exploded on the blogosphere last fall and Dylan quickly sold out of inventory in only weeks. After moving production to higher producing manufacturers, Dylan is seeking a $10,000 loan to secure inventory against holiday purchase orders.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory

loans.name: Riley

texts.en: Brooks Transportation Service provides chauffer services to businesses, tourists and individual travelers throughout the Los Angeles area including airports, meetings, weddings, sporting events, proms, graduations, anniversaries and local trips. Riley performs marketing through referrals, social media, mail campaigns, web promotions and various web-group coupons. Riley will use the $10,000 requested to to purchase a limousine to expand their service availability.

loans.use: To purchase a limousine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 38-year-old single mother of three children, all in school, lives in Mukono, Uganda. For the past eight years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells posho, rice, sugar, soda, tea and other household staples.

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy flour, rice and sugar to sell. This will help her to generate greater profits which will improve her standard of living. She hopes to have a big business in the future.

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Lin, a 37-year-old mother, is a rural villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, three of whom are students at a local school, while the remaining one is a paid worker. To support the basic expenses of her household, she and her husband have been working on one hectare of farmland for several years to grow paddy rice. This is their main source of income. They also use their spare time to earn additional income via working for others for a fee.  Lin took out her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) in 2011 and repaid the entire loan with success. That loan supported her business and provided her family with a consistent income to maintain their living conditions. Now, she is applying for a second loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer to boost her yield. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner so as to ensure her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost her yield

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 30 years, and is married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Amer owns a car repairing shop. He established his business in 2002 and he now has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a youth loan of $2400 to buy a machine specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his car repair work.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es: La. Sra. Luciana es casada y tiene dos dependientes económicos. Ella y su esposo trabajan en una maquiladora de la localidad. La seguridad en el domicilio de Luciana es muy importante es por eso que ella está pidiendo de nuestra ayuda para construir un porton en su casa, para saber que sus hijos están resguardados, ya que la inseguridad en nuestra ciudad ha ido en aumento. Ella agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Luciana’s married and has two economic dependents.  She and her husband work in a local assembly plant.  Home security is very important for Luciana and this is why she’s asking for help to install a gate at home to be sure her children are safe because insecurity in the city has been increasing.  She will be very grateful for any help she can get.

loans.use: to build a gate around her house for added protection for her children

loans.name: Ma Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel, se encuentra separada
María tiene una tienda de abarrotes, misma a la que le dedica gran parte de su tiempo, con esmero y dedicación maría se preocupa por estar mejorando su negocio día a día invirtiéndole en mercancía para su mayor desempeño mercantil.
Así mismo desarrollando una mejor calidad de vida
Sobresaliendo en su ramo.
texts.en: María Isabel is currently separated.  She has a grocery store she spends most of her time in.  With effort and dedication she strives to improve her business day to day investing in merchandise to increase her business as well as developing a better quality of life and standing out in her line of work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to improve her store and sales

loans.name: Karin Susan

texts.es:
La socia Karin tiene 36 años de edad y pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad de Lima pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una mujer responsable que trabaja en una institución pública como profesora  pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo pinta bocas, perfumes, colonias, aretes, collares, anillos y otras cosas más. Ya es un año y medio que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Karin requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, pinta bocas y colonias.  El sueño de la socia Karin es abrir una tienda o un bazar donde pueda vender diferentes tipos de productos de belleza. 
  
La socia Karin se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Karin, 36, is a member of the communal bank “Mi Perú” of Asociación Arariwa. She was born in Lima but now lives in Cusco. She is a responsible woman and is a public school teacher. In her free time, she sells cosmetics and accessories such as lipsticks, perfumes, colognes, earrings, necklaces, rings, and other items. Her business is about a year and a half old and is prospering because of her dedication. 

At this time, Karin needs a loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes, lipsticks, and colognes.  Her dream is to open a shop where she can sell a variety of beauty products. Karin is grateful for the opportunity offered by the institution and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes, lipsticks, and colognes.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
La socia Laureana tiene 35 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa y es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y viven en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su hijo pues ella tiene una pequeña pizzería. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Laureana requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo jamón, queso, pasas, harina, frutas y otras cosas más.  El sueño de la socia Laureana es que su negocio se ha una de las más grandes pizzerías de la ciudad del Cusco y concurridas por la población. 

La socia Laureana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Laureana, 35, is in a free union and has a child with her partner. She is a member of the communal bank “Mi Perú” of Asociación Arariwa. She was born and still lives in the city of Cusco. She is a responsible mother who provides for her children and owns a pizzeria. She started the business two years ago, and it has prospered through her dedication.

At this time, Laureana needs a loan to buy supplies such as ham, raisins, wheat flour, fruits, and other items. Laureana's dream is that her business becomes one of the largest and busiest pizzerias in Cusco and the surrounding areas. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by the institution and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as ham, raisins, wheat flour, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Gigo Jesuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GIGO JESUTON est formé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Micheline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Micheline est mariée à un certain Anatole et a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Micheline vit seule avec ses enfants. Micheline et son mari supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Micheline n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a dix huit ans environs que Micheline mène comme activité la vente des ustensiles de cuisine et des glacières à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Micheline vend des tissus et des vêtements. Micheline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Micheline n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Micheline et les autres membres du groupe GIGO JESUTON sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The GIGO JESUTON group is comprised of four friends who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Micheline, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group is asking for financial support from ALIDé in order to grow their business.

Micheline is married to Anatole and has two dependent children - one of whom goes to school. Micheline lives with her children. Together, Micheline and her husband take care of their family's needs. Micheline did not go to school.

Micheline has been selling utensils and coolers out of her home for 18 years. As a secondary source of income, Micheline sells fabric and clothing. Micheline buys her supplies in a city in Benin. 

Her clients’ demands are growing and with her limited means, she finds it hard to respond to their needs. In view of that and taking into account their limited resources, Micheline and the other members of GIGO JESUTON are asking for a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabric, coolers, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: El Sr. Guadalupe  es casado y de 27 años, desde hace 2 años vive en casa de interés social. Guadalupe y su esposa son empleados de una maquiladora de la localidad en la cual cuenta ya con una  antigüedad de 5 años. El quiere ampliar su casa porque quiere brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y seguridad. Sabe que ampliando su casa podrá dejar un buen patrimonio. El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 27 years old and married.  He has lived in a government subsidized house for two years.  Guadalupe and his wife are employed by a factory in the area, and they have worked there for five years.

He wants to enlarge his house because he wants to give his family a better standard of living and security.  He knows that by enlarging his house he will be able to leave a good patrimony.  He will appreciate the help that can be given.

loans.use: to enlarge his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry  es un joven que vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en el cantón de Turrialba ubicado en la  provincia de Cartago. La ciudad de Cartago fue capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823, se caracteriza por tener un  relieve montañoso formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca, su clima es frío la mayoría del año consecuencia de los dos volcanes que posee llamados  Irazú y Turrialba.
Henry trabaja a varios kilómetros de distancia de su casa, y necesita un medio de transporte para trasladarse a su trabajo, se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir una motocicleta la cual usaría también los fines de semana para ofrecer sus servicios en diferentes restaurantes en la entrega de comidas  rápidas ,  considera que con la ayuda que le brinde la empresa de crédito comunal, él y su familia mejoraran poco a poco las condiciones de vida .
Para lograr su objetivo Henry solicita un microcrédito de ochocientos cincuenta mil colones (¢850.000.00), de esta manera comprará la motocicleta y a la vez aumenta sus ingresos con el trabajo extra que realizaría los fines de semana.
Henry es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Henry is a young man who lives with his family in the community fo Santa Teresita, in Turrialba region located in the province of Cartago. The city of Cartago was the capital of Costa Rica until 1823. It is known for its mountainous terrain formed by two mountain ranges: the Central, and the Talamanca. Its weather is cold the majority of the year because of the two nearby volcanoes, Irazú and Turrialba. 

Henry works several miles from his home and needs a form of transportation to travel to work. He was given the opportunity to purchase a motorcycle, which he would also use on the weekends to offer his services to different restaurants for fast food delivery. He believes that with the help that the community bank offers, little by little he and his family will improve their quality of life. 

To achieve his goal, Henry requests a loan of eight hundred fifty thousand colones (¢850.000.00). So, he will purchase the motorcycle and at the same time increase his profits with the extra work he will do on the weekends. 

Henry is a member of the El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba community bank, one of the 150 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria tiene 43 años de edad y es padre y madre para su único hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa y es natural del departamento de Apurímac y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su hijo pues ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar productos naturales como energizantes y otras mas. 

La socia Victoria se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria, 43, is both mother and father to her only son, and is a member of the communal bank “Mi Perú” of Asociación Arariwa. She was born in the department of Apurímac and now lives in the city of Cusco. She is a responsible mother who provides for her child. For several years, she has been selling natural products and has done well due to her dedication.

At this time, Victoria needs a loan to buy natural products such as energizers. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by the institution and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy natural products such as energizers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa y es natural del departamento de Puno y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una joven responsable que es profesional (Químico Farmacéutico), ella tiene  una farmacia pequeña  donde vende diferentes tipos de medicamentos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Gloria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería (Medicamentos) como por ejemplo pastillas, inyectables, pomadas, jarabes y otras cosas más.
 
La socia Gloria se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria, 26, is single and a member of the communal bank “Perú” of Asociación Arariwa. She was born in the department of Puno and now lives in the city of Cusco. She is a responsible woman and a pharmacist. For several years, she has owned a small pharmacy where she sells a variety of medications. The business has prospered due to her dedication.

At this time, Gloria needs a loan to buy medications such as pills, injectable drugs, ointments, syrups, and other items. Gloria is grateful for the opportunity offered by the institution and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy medications such as pills, injectable drugs, ointments, syrups, and other items.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 58-year-old woman and the mother of two grown up children from Bohol, Philippines. She is in the food vending business, selling snack foods to the people in their community. She is also in the farming business, growing agricultural crops such as corn, rice and bananas, among others.

Paula works hard to earn a living. She joined CEVI to gain access to the financial and training services offered by the organization. As of now, she is requesting another loan worth 10000 PHP for the expansion of her businesses. With this, she will be able to increase her yield and income.

Paula dreams of making her ventures a success. Moreover, she wants to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business and to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: G.s Los Hermanos Group

texts.es: G.S. los hermanos está conformado por dos integrantes que son: Flor Iselda, Seneyda . Las actividad económica de Flor es la venta de tortillas y frijoles cosidos, negocios que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de seguir luchando día a día por el bienestar de su familia, con el financiamiento comprara productos para invertir en su negocio como: frijoles, maíz, leña, arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, cuajada, detergentes, sal, pastas, jugos enlatados entre otros. Y de igual manera agradecen al proyecto kiva por ayudar a los pequeños comerciantes para tener un medio de subsistencia digno.
texts.en: G.S. "Los Hermanos" is formed by two members, Flor Iselda and Seneyda Pineda. Flor's business is selling tortlllas and cooked beans. Her business is located in her home. She is characterized by being hard-working and responsible, with the will to continue striving every day for the well-being of her family. With the financing, she will buy products to invest in her business, such as beans, corn, firewood, rice, sugar, mile, bread, cheese, detergents, salt, pastas, and canned juices, among other items. And in the same way they are grateful to the Kiva project for helping small business people to have a means of dignified subsistence.

loans.use: To buy products for her business such as beans, corn, firewood, rice, suger, milk, bread, chesse, detergent, salt, pastas, canned juices among other products

loans.name: Reyna Marlene

texts.es: Reyna Marlene de 37 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a una pulpería que tiene ubicada en el mercado de la localidad ,actividad que la inicio hace 1 año ante tenia por actividad economica la venta de ropa pero cambio de negocio y  consisten en la venta de productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, aceites, pan, leche, frijoles, jugos, huevos, crema, cuajadas, entre otros, Reyna es una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora la cual se levanta todos los días muy temprano para abrir tu tramo en el mercado y con ganas siempre de seguir trabajando, da gracias a fundación y el programa kiva por brindar la ayuda que le ofrecen a pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos para seguir trabajando día a día y tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en: Reyna Marlene is 37 years old, is married and has 3 children who are all minors. She earns her living from a general store which she started a year ago, located in the market of the area. She used to have a store selling clothes, but she switched her line of work.  Her business now involves the sale of daily consumables such as rice, beans, oils, bread, milk, juice, eggs, cream and cottage cheese. Reyna is a very hard-working, persevering woman who wakes up very early every day to open her store in the market and always with enthusiasm to continue working. She is grateful to Fundacion and the Kiva program for the support they give to small entrepreneurs with few resources to keep working day by day to have a dignified way of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oils, bread, milk, juice, eggs, cream and cottage cheese amongst other items.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es: Reymundo Urbina es originario de San Lorenzo una pequeña comunidad en las afueras de Teustepe es casado, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad,  se dedica a la agricultura. Inicio a trabajar desde niño aprendió con su papa realizaban siembra para el consumo para todo el año hoy en día  siembra mas para comercializar y comprar utilidades para la casa cuando la cosecha son buenas logra comprar terneras  su  familia lo apoya sale a vender el producto a la carretera. A él le gustaría  vender  una mayor producción de frijoles ya que es un producto muy demandado por sus clientes ya que forma parte del alimento diario que se consume. El  solicita préstamo para la compra de de abono, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra, para sembrar frijol Esto le  ayudara a tener mejor producción con los ingreso compraría activos para seguir trabajando en el futuro piensa reparar su  vivienda, su  meta es sacar el  cultivo con éxito para pagar este crédito y seguir progresando y trabajando duro por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Reymundo Urbina was born in San Lorenzo, a small community on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is married, has four grown children, and is a farmer. He learned farming as a child from his father as they planted the annual crops that sustained the family. Today he plants more crops to sell and buy household items. When the harvest is abundant, he is able to buy calves. His family helps him sell his products at a roadside stand.

He would like to sell more beans, which are in great demand from his customers because they are part of the daily diet. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pay laborers to plant beans. This will increase his production, and with the additional income, he will buy assets to keep working. He is thinking about remodeling his house. His goal is to have a successful harvest to pay this loan and continue working hard and making progress for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay laborers to plant beans.

loans.name: Alexandr

texts.ru:
Александр,  начинающий фермер. С прошлого года начал заниматься выращиванием малины капусты, помидора, лука.  
По хозяйству ему помогает 25-ти летний сын, который занимается частным предпринимательством.
Начинал Александр  свою фермерскую  деятельность с постройки небольшой теплицы на 50м3 где выращивал  ранние помидоры и капусту.
 Для развития своего фермерского хозяйства,  Александр решил приобрести  150 саженцев малины и 200 саженцев ежевики.
В ближайших планах  - приобрести капельный полив для саженцев малины и ежевики.
Главная цель в  личных планах  Александра –  построить новый дом.
texts.en: Aleksandr is a beginning farmer. For the past year he has been growing raspberries, cabbage, tomatoes, and onions. His 25 year-old son, who is a private businessman, helps him out on the farm. Aleksandr began his farming career by building a small (50 cubic meters) greenhouse in which he grows early tomatoes and cabbage. To develop his farming business, Aleksandr decided to buy 150 sazhens (320 meters) of plums and 200 sazhens (425 meters) of blackberries. His immediate plan is to buy an irrigation system for the raspberries and blackberries. The biggest goal in Aleksandr's plans is to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
At Steele's Tax Service , Esther offers public notarizing, bookkeeping and tax filing in her hometown of Corpus Christi. Esther’s house is located on a busy street, so she’ll have exposure. It also has ample parking for clients.

Since she works out of her home, Esther has the ability to create her own schedule, which allows her to give optimum customer service. She can and will open her office for anyone at anytime, and if need be, go to a client’s house.

“My passion started in high school in my bookkeeping class,” Esther said. The one chapter on taxes inspired her to begin filing taxes for family and friends for fun, then in 1986, Esther took class with H&R Block to learn of a change in the filing process, and that’s when her business really began.

For 15 years after that, Esther went to work for an established income tax filing company. After offering options of how to improve their business, Esther learned that her suggestions were not going to be met, as the head of the corporation was the one to make any and all decisions. She later quit that job to work with a Certified Public Accountant who was making ten times what she was earning for filing taxes. From then, she decided to open her own business.

At her previous place of employment, clients would wait two to three hours for her services. Beginning in 2004 with part-time hours, Esther hired a receptionist for tax season; her business grew and she began offering full-time hours of operation in 2009. Currently, Esther has applied for a loan to hire another tax filer, or someone for data input, and extend her office to fit a waiting room that will include a play area for children, instead of having every client stand around. The expansion will include a restroom. None of this would be possible without the assistance of an Accion Texas Inc. loan.

Passionate about learning more within her field, Esther attends Del Mar College every fall. It was there, in her business principles class, that she learned about resources and loans offered at Accion. “I’m just really excited,” she said.

loans.use: To hire employees and add a room to her office.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories for his notions shop

loans.name: Leonardo Robinson

texts.es:
LEONARDO ROBINSON tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y con los dos hijos. 

Es integrante de la VRC Luchando por una misma causa, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la primavera, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica laores agricolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

LEONARDO ROBINSON se ddeica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz además se dedica a la crianza de animales cómo gallinas, cerdos.

Solicita el credito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, balanceado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace para los cultivos.

 Las compras de los productos lo realizará en ventanas. El sueño e spoder sembrar este nuevo año 6 héctares más de terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es seguir adelante junto a la familia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Leonardo Robinson, 40, lives with  his common-law wife and they have two children.

He is a member of the VRC Luchando group that is located in the La Primavera area of the Ventanas canton.  This branch has farmers who work with short cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Leonardo Robinson plants corn and rice, and also raises animals like chickens and pigs.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, insecticides and balanced food.  The loan will help him purchase the fertilizers that he needs for his crops.

He will buy the supplies in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to plant 6 hectares more of fields this coming year.  The challenges that he faces is to continue getting his family ahead.

In his free time he likes to watch tv.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer, urea, insecticides and balanced food

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 40 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Hazel has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing feeds for her business. 

Hazel has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Hazel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Gina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Gina tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera pero tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa y es natural del departamento de Puno y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia pues ella tiene  una tienda de abarrotes pequeña  donde vende diferentes tipos de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Gina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería (Abarrotes) como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, fideos y otras cosas más. 

La socia Gina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gina is 28 years old and is a single mother of 2 children. She is part of “Mi Peru” (My Peru) community bank of the “Asociación Arariwa” (Arariwa Association). She is a native of Puno and currently lives in Cusco. She is a responsible mother that gets her family ahead. 

She owns a small grocery store that sells a variety products of basic need. It has been 2 years that she has worked in this business and it is doing well due to her dedication to her work.Gina is asking for a loan for an opportunity to buy groceries such as sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, noodles and some other items.

Gina is very grateful for the opportunity and promises make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, noodles and other items

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra 
Cerdos de engorde 
1.000.000

 	Alejandra es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superación tiene 45 años de edad y es nacida en Nicaragua. Desde hace 12 años se dedica  a la crianza de cerdos.  En un inicio y por espacio mantenía  una cantidad pequeña de cerdos en su casa que vendía sin haber terminado su desarrollo. 

	Con dedicación y trabajo logró obtener un capital que le permite trasladarse a unas instalaciones más amplias aumentando su inventario de cerdos, comprando más cerdas de cría y teniendo su propio ciclo de producción de cerdos. Aunque las instalaciones requieren de más mejoras ella junto a su esposo han logrado condiciones acordes para el desarrollo de la actividad. 

	Es una actividad familiar, un vecino les alquila un lugar, el cual ellos mejoran y les va a permitir la cría de cerca de cerdos en mejores condiciones de espacio y sanidad. Actualmente vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en el Barrio San José de Alajuela.

	
	Se cuenta en este momento 50 cerdos de 2  meses de edad y la alimentación por para 2 meses, además se proyecta el nacimiento de otros 40 cerditos que iniciaran un nuevo ciclo de producción. 

	Se proyecta un crédito con 3 pagos semestrales para apoyar en este momento la compra de alimentación de cría y desarrollo ya que el desarrollo de los cerdos es de 6 meses. Manteniendo este nivel de producción se va a contar en las respectivas fechas con los ingresos suficientes para el pago de la cuota del préstamo además de un inventario de alimentación para continuar con los ciclos respectivos.

	 El crédito anterior le permitió salir de su casa y crecer pasando de vender cerdos muy pequeños a venderlos ya en su peso óptimo. Aunque las instalaciones requieren de más mejoras, ella junto a su esposo han logrado condiciones acordes para el desarrollo de la actividad. En este momento tiene 4 cerdas de cría, a punto de parir y un macho para reproducción  en plenas condiciones y cerca de 50 cerdos de cría para los cuales requiere del capital para su alimentación
texts.en:
Alejandra is a hard working woman and has a desire to move forward. She is 45 years old and was born in Nicaragua. She has worked raising pigs for 12 years. At first, because of space, she kept a small number of pigs in her house and sold them before they were grown. 

With dedication and work, she was able to get capital allowed her to move to bigger facilities, increasing her inventory of pigs, buying more breeding sows and having her own production cycle of pigs. Even though the facilities require more improvements, she and her husband have created appropriate conditions to carry out this activity.

It is a family activity. A neighbor rents them a place, which they improve and it will allow them to raise pigs in better space and health conditions. She currently lives with her husband and three children in Barrio San Jose in Alajuela.   
	
Right now, she has 50 pigs who are two months old and food for two months. She also predicts the the birth of 40 more pigs which will start a new cycle of production.

A loan with 3 half-yearly payments is projected to support the purchase of pig feed and development since the development of the pigs is 6 months. Maintaining this level of production, she will have enough income to make the payments for the loan on the respective dates, in addition to a food inventory to continue with the respective cycle.

The previous loan allowed her to leave her home and grow from selling small pigs to pigs at their optimal weight. Even though the facilities require more improvements, she and her husband have achieved appropriate conditions for the development of the activity. Right now she has four breeding sows about to give birth and one male in full condition for reproduction and about 50 pigs for which she needs the money for their food.

loans.use: to buy food for raising fattened pigs.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is age 32 and is a married mother living in a rural village of Dambae district. She has two daughters who are students in the local public school. She and her husband struggle in making a daily income from their 1.5 hectare farmland and 1 hectare area where they grow rice and beans, respectively. 

For the last several years, she has been engaged in this business and is able to earn almost 21,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She is seeking 1,300,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her rice farm. She hopes to make more healthy rice so as maintain her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her rice farm.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 56 years old and lives in a small village of Terjola district. She is a widow and lives with her daughter, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Natela’s grandchildren go to the local kindergarten. Her son works in pawnshop and gets a monthly salary. 

Natela runs her agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. The family also owns a vineyard.  Natela is involved in an animal husbandry business as well. She has two milking cows, three calves and three sheep. She produces cheese and sells it locally. The family sells lambs in the nearby villages, too. Natela is a very hardworking woman with a rich experience in her work.

Natela requested a loan to build a cattle shed. With this loan, she will purchase building materials. Natela plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the building is expanded, Natela will purchase livestock, and she will be able to double the production and sales of cheese. The income of the family will significantly increase. All members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Dieu Seul Suffit Group

texts.fr: DIEU SEUL SUFFIT est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Généviève Akouavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Gatient. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent à leur charge. Généviève Akouavi a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Généviève Akouavi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Généviève Akouavi vend des poissons dans sa région. Généviève Akouavi s’approvisionne dans une ville un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Généviève Akouavi et les autres membres du groupe DIEU SEUL SUFFIT sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés
texts.en:
DIEU SEUL SUFFIT is a three-person group where the members all live in the same neighborhood. 

The group representative, Généviève Akouavi (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 and married to a stockist named Gatient. The couple has four children (3 dependent), and all of their children went to school. Généviève Akouavi stopped attending to school in high school. Généviève Akouavi lives with her children and her husband, and she and her husband take care of the family expenses.

Généviève Akouavi has been selling fish in her region for close to 15 years. Généviève Akouavi buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

This is the third time that Généviève Akouavi and DIEU SEUL SUFFIT are asking for the financial support from ALIDé in order reinforce their working capital and better respond to the demands of their clientele. Their two previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aimée Houévo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Aimée Houévo est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Justin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Aimée Houévo a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Aimée Houévo vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Aimée Houévo mène comme activité la vente de mèches et des produits de cheveux depuis une dizaine d’année dans sa région. Aimée Houévo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Aimée Houévo vend parallèlement à la première activité, des vernis et des produits vivriers. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Aimée Houévo sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The BIDOSSESSI group is comprised of four people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the first time that this group is asking for ALIDé’s  financial support in order to grow their business. 

The group representative, Aimée Houévo, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Aimée Houévo is 32 and is married to a freight broker named Justin. The couple has two dependent children, both of whom go to school. Aimée Houévo stopped going to school in elementary school. 

Aimée Houévo lives with her husband and her children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. To pay for her expenses, Aimée Houévo has been selling hair extensions and hair products in her region for about a decade. Aimée Houévo buys her supplies in a market in Benin. As a secondary business, Aimée Houévo sells varnish as well as food products. 

With the goal of satisfying her clients and in order to grow her sales volume and income, Aimée Houévo and BIDOSSESSI are asking for their first loan from ALIDé. This loan will help them increase their inventory and grow their customer base.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and food products.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago presenta un relieve montañoso  formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca. Esta ciudad fue capital de Costa Rica en 1823.
Desde hace varios  años Ricardo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la  producción de chile dulce. Logra vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de este producto. En su caso particular, la demanda ha crecido ya que algunos restaurantes locales le compran también el chile .   
Actualmente necesita  obtener un microcrédito por ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones), para comprar  almácigo (plantas pequeñas) de chile dulce y extender su siembra, además necesita suministros para cuidar y proteger su cosecha de plagas y hongos.
Ricardo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita, in the province of Cartago. The city of Cartago has a mountainous relief formed by two mountain ranges: the Cordilera Central and the Cordillera de Talamanca. This city was the capital of Costa Rica in 1823.

For several years Ricardo has worked in agriculture, specifically the production of peppers. He sells his products to neighbors in the community who are very satisfied with the quality of this product. In his particular case, the demand has grown so that some local restaurants also buy the peppers.

Currently he needs to obtain a loan for ¢300,000 (three hundred thousand colones) to buy seed-beds (seedlings) of peppers to renew his sowing and also he needs supplies to care for and protect his crop from pests and fungi.

Ricardo is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, one of the 150 organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy seed-beds (seedlings) of peppers

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a single mother of three children; two of her children go to school, and the third one is too young. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell on a retail basis seven days a week.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is single with two children. 

Teresita works in the fish industry and sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lout's Group

texts.en:
Lout is a single woman originally from Kampong Cham province's Dambae district in Cambodia. She is a peasant who grows rice on a 2-hectare area and plants cassava on 1.5 hectare of farmland in order to earn a living. She has been with this business for five years and is challenged by the fruitless crop caused by drought. 

Lout received her first loan with VisionFund and has finished the past three loans already with success. She has managed to repay the entire loans, which have helped her to manage her daily expenses, especially decent food. 

To continue better support for her business, she formed a group of two members to request a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and insecticide for her farm. She hopes to receive more yields and sell it for a good price in order to double her income and make her living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her farm.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Él siempre se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, desde que tenia ocho años, fue su padre quien le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, herbecidas y pago de mano de obra; para sembrar, limpiar y sacar la cosecha. Con la producción él dispondrá de maíz suficiente para su consumo y cuando exista la necesidad vender a otras personas. Él desea cultivar más, para mejorar sus ingresos y no tener que recurrir a préstamos.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and has a child. His father taught him how to work on agricultural jobs and he has been working since he was 8 years old. 

The loan that he is requesting to is buy 4 sacks of manure, herbicides, and payment of manual labor to clean and remove the crops for sowing. With the production he will have sufficient for consumption and sale to other people.  He desires to cultivate more products to increase his income and no longer borrow loans.

loans.use: to is buy 4 sacks of manure, herbicides, and payment of manual labor to clean and remove the crops for sowing

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
RufinaRufina, 59 years old and living in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, is married but separated. For the past three years Rufina has owned a sari-sari store to earn a living, making a monthly income of about PHP 5000.

A member of PMPC for three years, she has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional groceries to sell. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Luis y su hijo Eduardo en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías cuadros, separadores, tejas decoradas entre otros, tiene varios años de tener el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite realizar una labor de calidad, la venta esta ubicada en su vivienda en una zona muy concurrida de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela  la prefieren por el producto de calidad, por los buenos precios y además por el servicio inigualable; Ana es una mujer emprendedora, enérgica, y soñadora quiere salir adelante por sus propios méritos y no descansara hasta ganarse un futuro mas prospero, en los últimos meses tuvo algunas perdidas pero desea recuperarse e innovar con su producto, pero necesita de capital para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, madera, pintura, barniz,  etc. Ana Ruth tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable y asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth is 49 years old. She lives with her life companion Luis and her son Eduardo in their own home. 

She works selling handicraft paintings, partitions, decorated tiles, and other items. She has had the business for several years and has gained experience in sales that allows her to perform quality work. She sells from home in a very busy area of people and so has many customers who prefer her for the quality product, for the good prices and for the unequaled service. 

Ana is an enterprising woman, energetic, and an idealist who wants to get ahead by her own merits and not rest until she wins a more prosperous future. In recent months she had some losses but she wants to recover and try some new methods for her product but she needs capital for a new investment and this is why she is asking Integral for a loan which will permit her to buy tiles, wood, paint, varnish, etc. 

Ana Ruth has good payment references and she is sure she can pay the debt and at the same time she is confident that she can offer her family a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy tiles, wood, paint and varnish for her handicraft business

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
Ana Virginia es una educadora que trabaja con niños de 3 a 4 años de edad, ella  vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. El relieve de esta ciudad es bastante montañoso,  está formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca. Cartago fue capital de Costa Rica hasta 1.823
Ana Virginia se esmera para que los niños con los que trabaja académicamente reciban una buena educación de la mano con la tecnología actual ,  por eso quiere adquirir  una computadora para agilizar su trabajo y compartirla con los pequeños, para ello necesita un crédito de quinientos cincuenta mil colones (¢550.000) para comprarla.
Ana Virginia forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Dice que con este crédito espera poder instruir a estos niños y además agilizar sus labores educativas.
texts.en:
Ana Virginia is an educator who works with children who are from three to four years old. She lives with her family in the community of Santa Teresita, in the province of Cartago. 

The relief of this city is very mountainous. It's formed by two mountain ranges: the Central and the mountain range of Talamanca. Cartago was the capital of Costa Rica until 1823.

Ana Virginia strives to provide good education using new technology for the children with who she works academically. Thus, she wants to buy a computer to make her work faster and to share it with the children. To do it, she needs a loan of five hundred and fifty thousand colones (¢ 550,000) to buy it. 

Ana Virginia is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal of El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. She says that with this loan she hopes to educate these children and also to do her educational work faster.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Floridah

texts.en:
Floridah has been in farming for twenty years, besides running a retail business in the local market. She says farming caters to a bigger portion of her family’s needs. She is married, with two children aged twelve and fourteen years.

Floridah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo for a venture into poultry farming. She says she will use the income to expand her farming business and buy more acres of land. Her focus is on making her farming business a lucrative one.

She compliments Juhudi Kilimo for the efficiency in disbursement of loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (old parents). 

She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation, seasonality, and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major expenses include rent, paying for utilities, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon, a 42-year-old married father of three children for whom he tries to provide all the necessities of life, sells auto parts to earn a living. In business for six years, he has many customers and serves them perfectly.

Anvarjon is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to purchase batteries to expand his assortment of products. He dreams of further expanding his enterprise and becoming prosperous in the future. He will look for your help.

loans.use: to buy batteries to expand his assortment of products.

loans.name: Sokuntheary's Group

texts.en:
Sokuntheary, a villager living in Kampong Cham province's Dambae district of Cambodia, is a 42-year-old mother of five children. 

To make a constant income for her family's sake, she has been running a small food stall for ten years. She has never taken any loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, the same as her co-member. She leads this group of two and both of them are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. 

Sokuntheary will use her portion to buy more food ingredients and canned food plus more grocery items to resell as an extra income. She expects to double her income from her current business to sustain a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients and canned food plus more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Robiina

texts.en:
Robiina, a 32-year-old resident of Kisekende, located in the Mubende region of Uganda, is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Robiina has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells cosmetics such as body lotions.

To help expand her business, Robiina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale and will help her to generate greater profits and stock more items. Robiina hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a residential house.

Robiina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robiina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny es un hombre de 36 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Johnny está solicitando un préstamo de doscientos mil colones exactos (¢200.000 ), para comprar fungicidas e insecticidas para darle mantenimiento a su siembra de maíz  y  proteger sus cultivos,  ya que esta  es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Johnny evitará que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes.
 Johnny es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Johnny is a 36-year-old man that lives with his family in an area of the south end of Costa Rica in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on farming, stockbreeding, and mainly the sowing of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock. 

Johnny is asking for a loan of 200,000 colones to buy fungicides and insecticides to maintain the sowing of corn and protect his crop since this is a sustainable and reliable alternative.  

With this loan, Johnny can avoid that fungus will appear on his crops and thus offer quality products to his customers. Johnny is a member of the “Empresa de Credito Comunal de la Danta S.A.” (Business of Community Credit of Danta, S.A.), one of the 150 community banks in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 58, Yorn is a married mother of seven children. The rest of her family resides in a rural area of Dambae District, Cambodia. To strive for a good living, she manages three hectares of farmland for growing rice and two hectares for growing cassava; it is the business that she has been involved in for ages.

Her main challenge with the current business is the dropping price of her cash-crop. Yorn has never worked with Kiva's partner, VisionFund before. Her group composes of two members--her co-member is also a first-time borrower. 

Yorn is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR whilst her co-member is seeking 600,000 KHR. Yorn, as the leader, will use her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee for the rice field and the weeding fee for the cassava plantation. She hopes to gain a high yield and make more income in order to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee for the rice field and the weeding fee for the cassava plantation.

loans.name: Fransina

texts.en:
Fransina is a 42-year-old mother of 4 children: Lita, 22 and Lian, 20 - who are both attending university; Haris, 12, who is attending Junior High School Grade 1; and Adi, 3 years old. Fransina’s husband, Andri, is a 46-year-old entrepreneur. 

Fransina owns two businesses: poultry and pig breeding. One month ago, Fransina suffered a loss when the chickens were infected from disease. At the moment, she just relies on her pig breeding business. She is planning to continue her poultry business but she needs business capital to do so. 

Fransina has applied for a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She would like to buy 2 boxes of chicks, the fodder, vaccine, and vitamins. She really hopes to restart her business so she is able to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of chicks, the fodder, vaccine, and vitamins.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Rebecca works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 19 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase kilos of fishes to sell.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of fishes to sell.

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of 12 grown up children. She is from Bohol, Philippines. She has owned a tricycle transportation business for more than six years now. This provides her the income that she needs for their sustenance.

Gelasia has been a member of CEVI for several years now. She likes the services offered by the organization because it really helped her in improving her livelihood. As of now, she is requesting a new loan worth 18,000 PHP to buy spare parts and fuel for the tricycle. With this, the working condition of the vehicle will be revived to its normal condition.

Gelasia believes that if she will be provided with financial support through a loan, she will be able to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer in Nkubu and has been farming for twenty years. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand and sells her produce, which includes milk, fruits and vegetables, to the local market. She is married with four children, the last two still being of school age.

Esther has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy feed for her dairy cows. She says the additional income will go to improving her family living standards as well as expanding her farming business. She says the acquisition of animal feed during rainy seasons will save her significant costs with the income being channeled into other farming needs.

She says poor infrastructure is a significant challenge often resulting into high transport costs.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 24 years of age, married with one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Salah owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2007 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3000 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Sam Eean's Group

texts.en:
Sam Eean, age 37, is a mother of three children who are students in the local public school. To provide daily decent food for her children, she needs to make a living through crop planting on 1 hectare of farmland (paddy rice) and a 3-hectare area (cassava). 

She has been with this business for 17 years and is challenged with the dwindling price of cassava. 

Sam Eean's group consists of two members; both are females and first-loan borrowers. She and her fellow group member are requesting 1,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, her entire loan portion will be used to pay for the weeding fee for her cassava field.  She hopes to boost her crop production to multiply her income so as to improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To pay for the weeding of her cassava field.

loans.name: Yolán

texts.es:
Yolán  es un agricultor de 34 años  de edad,  vive con su esposa y su hijo  de tres años en la  comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería, y otros productos.
Yolán desarrolla la actividad de la siembra de café desde hace varios años, lo que le genera una única fuente de ingreso familiar, por lo tanto desea expandirse más en cuanto a área de siembra y para ello necesita un  préstamo por  quinientos mil colones exactos (¢500.000) para comprar almácigo de café (Plantas pequeñas) y así lograr la producción de este producto y proveer de semilla a otros productores.
Yolán l es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A.  y manifiesta estar muy agradecido porque este es un medio de adquirir financiamiento de acceso rápido y a plazos aceptables para gente trabajadora y que desea superarse.
texts.en:
Yolán is a 34-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in of the south zone of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on farming activities, mainly the sowing of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock breeding, and other products. 

For several years Yolán has developed the sowing of coffee, which has allowed him to have a steady income. He desires to expand his sowing and therefore needs a loan of 500,000 colones to buy small coffee plants to accomplish the production of the product and provide seeds to other producers. 

Yolán is a member of the “Empresa de Credito Comunal de la Danta S.A.” (Business of Community Credit of Danta, S.A.). He is very grateful for the loan as a means of quick access to financing on credit available to hard working people who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy small coffee plants

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She makes and sells bricks from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years.  Maria gets additional income from teaching.  She works five days per week. She has requested a loan of Uganda Shillings 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy firewood for burning bricks. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land to expand the brick making business and to build a pre-primary and day care centre. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to make bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Teymurkhan

texts.en: Teymurkhan is married and has two daughters and a son. Five years ago, he decided to set up a general store in order to contribute economically to the household and improve his family's quality of life. In his store, he sells food and personal products like tea, sugar, oil, chips and other snack foods. The shop is his main source of income. To expand his retailing, he took out this loan for 1,000 AZN  to purchase stock.  Teymurkhan hopes to further grow his general store and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio tiene 45 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y tres hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luis Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, liquido mata maleza. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. El sueño es poder seguir incrementando las siembras.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota y disfrutar de lo Le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio, 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The members of V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA (Fighting for the Same Cause) are located in the La Primavera neighborhood, Ventanas canton. This communal bank dedicates itself to short cycle farm labor, sowing corn and rice. 

Luis Antonio works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products in Ventanas.

He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, and weedkiller. The support from the loan will help him meet his needs. His dream is to be able to keep increasing his planting.

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Ele-Gbe Group

texts.fr: ELE-GBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Pauline Ibukun (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée 46 ans. Ne vivant plus avec son mari, Pauline Ibukun est mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé, et tous à sa charge. Pauline Ibukun vit seule avec ses enfants et assure les différentes charges des enfants. Pauline Ibukun a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pauline Ibukun est la coordonnatrice d’une ONG du Bénin. Il y a près de quinze ans que Pauline Ibukun vend des savons liquides qu'elle prépare elle même. Pauline Ibukun exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pauline Ibukun s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Pauline Ibukun sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe ELE-GBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
ELE-GBE is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group's representative, Pauline Ibukun (raising her hand in the photo), is 46 years old.

Although she no longer lives with her husband, Pauline Ibukun is the mother of two children, one of whom goes to school.  Both children are her dependents.  She lives alone with her children and covers the various expenses associated with raising them.

Pauline Ibukun left school at the secondary level.  She now coordinates a non governmental organization in Benin.

She has been making and selling liquid soap for almost fifteen years now, buying her supplies in Benin. She has a passion for her work, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs, she is requesting her first loan, along with the members of the ELE-GBE group.  This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' needs and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make liquid soap.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and all her children go to school. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis.
